Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502 Voluntary school improvement and transfer processes.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1): 53E-5-301; 53E-5-301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(a): "High performing charter school" means a charter school that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(a)(i): satisfies all requirements of state law and state board rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(a)(ii): has operated for at least three years meeting the terms of the school's charter agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(a)(iii): is in good standing with the charter school's authorizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(b): 53E-5-301 "Low performing charter school" means a charter school that is designated a low performing school, as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(1)(c): 53E-5-301 "School turnaround plan" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(2)(a): Subject to Subsection (2)(b), a charter school governing board may voluntarily request the charter school's authorizer to place the charter school, including a low performing charter school that has a school turnaround plan, in a school improvement process.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(2)(b): A charter school governing board shall provide notice and a hearing on the charter school governing board's intent to make a request under Subsection (2)(a) to parents of students enrolled in the charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(3): An authorizer may grant a charter school governing board's request to be placed in a school improvement process if the charter school governing board has provided notice and a hearing under Subsection (2)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(4): An authorizer that has entered into a school improvement process with a charter school governing board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(4)(a): enter into a contract with the charter school governing board on the terms of the school improvement process;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(4)(b): notify the state board that the authorizer has entered into a school improvement process with the charter school governing board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(4)(c): make a report to a committee of the state board regarding the school improvement process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(4)(d): notify the Utah Charter School Finance Authority that the authorizer has entered into a school improvement process with the charter school governing board if the charter school is a qualifying charter school with outstanding bonds issued in accordance with Part 6, Charter School Credit Enhancement Program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(5): Upon notification under Subsection (4)(b), and after the report described in Subsection (4)(c), the state board shall notify charter schools and the school district in which the charter school is located that the charter school governing board has entered into a school improvement process with the charter school's authorizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(6): A high performing charter school or the school district in which the charter school is located may apply to the charter school governing board to assume operation and control of the charter school that has been placed in a school improvement process.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7): 53G-5-503 A charter school governing board that has entered into a school improvement process shall review applications submitted under Subsection (6) and submit a proposal to the charter school's authorizer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(a): 53G-5-503 terminate the school's charter, notwithstanding the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(b): transfer operation and control of the charter school to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(b)(i): the school district in which the charter school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(b)(ii): the governing board of another charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(b)(iii): a private management company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(7)(b)(iv): the governing board of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(8): A charter school governing board that has not entered into a school improvement process may voluntarily provide a proposal to the authorizer for consideration of transferring operation and control of the charter school to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(8)(a): the school district in which the charter school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(8)(b): the governing board of another charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(8)(c): a private management company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(8)(d): the governing board of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(9): 53G-5-503 Except as provided in Subsection (10) and subject to Subsection (11), an authorizer may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(9)(a): approve a charter school governing board's proposal under Subsection (7); or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(9)(b): 53G-5-503

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(9)(b)(ii): 53G-5-503
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(9)(b)(ii)(A): 53G-5-503 terminate the school's charter agreement in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(10): An authorizer may not take an action under Subsection (9) for a qualifying charter school with outstanding bonds issued in accordance with Part 6, Charter School Credit Enhancement Program, without mutual agreement of the Utah Charter School Finance Authority and the authorizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11)(a): An authorizer that intends to transfer operation and control of a charter school as described in Subsection (7)(b) shall request approval from the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11)(b)(i): The state board shall consider an authorizer's request under Subsection (11)(a) within 30 days of receiving the request.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11)(b)(ii): If the state board denies an authorizer's request under Subsection (11)(a), the authorizer may not transfer operation and control of the charter school as described in Subsection (7)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(11)(b)(iii): If the state board does not take action on an authorizer's request under Subsection (11)(a) within 30 days of receiving the request, an authorizer may proceed to transfer operation and control of the charter school as described in Subsection (7)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-502(12): If operation and control of a low performing charter school that has a school turnaround plan is transferred to a high performing charter school as described in Subsection (7)(b), the low performing charter school shall complete the requirements of the school turnaround plan and any other requirements imposed by the authorizer for school improvement.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503 Termination of a charter agreement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1): Subject to the requirements of Subsection (3), a charter school authorizer may terminate a school's charter agreement for any of the following reasons:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(a): failure of the charter school to meet the requirements stated in the charter agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(b): failure to meet generally accepted standards of fiscal management;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(c)(i): designation as a low performing school under Title 53E, Chapter 5, Part 3, School Improvement and Leadership Development; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(c)(ii): failure to improve the school's performance under the conditions described in Title 53E, Chapter 5, Part 3, School Improvement and Leadership Development;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(d): violation of requirements under this chapter or another law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(1)(e): other good cause shown.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(a): The authorizer shall notify the following of the proposed termination in writing, state the grounds for the termination, and stipulate that the charter school governing board may request an informal hearing before the authorizer:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(a)(i): the charter school governing board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(a)(ii): if the charter school is a qualifying charter school with outstanding bonds issued in accordance with Part 6, Charter School Credit Enhancement Program, the Utah Charter School Finance Authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(e), the authorizer shall conduct the hearing in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act, within 30 days after the day a written request under Subsection (2)(a) is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(c): If the authorizer, by majority vote, approves a motion to terminate a charter school, the charter school governing board may appeal the decision to the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(d)(i): The state board shall hear an appeal of a termination made in accordance with Subsection (2)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(d)(ii): The state board's action is final action subject to judicial review.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(e)(i): If the authorizer proposes to terminate the charter agreement of a qualifying charter school with outstanding bonds issued in accordance with Part 6, Charter School Credit Enhancement Program, the authorizer shall conduct a hearing described in Subsection (2)(b) 120 days or more after notifying the following of the proposed termination:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(e)(i)(A): the charter school governing board of the qualifying charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(e)(i)(B): the Utah Charter School Finance Authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(2)(e)(ii): Before the hearing described in Subsection (2)(e)(i), the Utah Charter School Finance Authority shall meet with the authorizer to determine whether the deficiency may be remedied in lieu of termination of the qualifying charter school's charter agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(3): An authorizer may not terminate the charter agreement of a qualifying charter school with outstanding bonds issued in accordance with Part 6, Charter School Credit Enhancement Program, without mutual agreement of the Utah Charter School Finance Authority and the authorizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(4)(a): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the state board shall make rules that require a charter school to report any threats to the health, safety, or welfare of the charter school's students to the State Charter School Board in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(4)(b): The rules under Subsection (4)(a) shall also require the charter school report to include what steps the charter school has taken to remedy the threat.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(5): Subject to the requirements of Subsection (3), the authorizer may terminate a charter agreement immediately if good cause has been shown or if the health, safety, or welfare of the students at the charter school is threatened.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(6): If a charter agreement is terminated, the following entities may apply to the charter school's authorizer to assume operation of the school:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(6)(a): the school district where the charter school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(6)(b): the charter school governing board of another charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(6)(c): a private management company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(6)(d): the governing board of a nonprofit corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(7)(a): If a charter agreement is terminated, a student who attended the school may apply to and shall be enrolled in another public school under the enrollment provisions in accordance with Chapter 6, Part 3, School District Residency, subject to space availability.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-503(7)(b): Normal application deadlines shall be disregarded under Subsection (7)(a).


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504 Charter school closure.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(1): As used in this section, "receiving charter school" means a charter school that an authorizer permits under Subsection (12)(a), to accept enrollment applications from students of a closing charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(2): 53G-5-503 If a charter school is closed for any reason, including the termination of a charter agreement in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(3): 53G-5-503; 53G-5-503 A decision to close a charter school is made:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(3)(a): 53G-5-503 when a charter school authorizer approves a motion to terminate described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(3)(b): 53G-5-503 when the state board takes final action described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(3)(c): when a charter school provides notice to the charter school's authorizer that the charter school is relinquishing the charter school's charter.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4): 63G-30-102
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a): 63G-30-102 No later than 10 days after the day on which a decision to close a charter school is made, the charter school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i): provide notice to the following, in writing, of the decision:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(A): if the charter school made the decision to close, the charter school's authorizer;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(B): if the state board did not make the decision to close, the state board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(C): parents of students enrolled at the charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(D): the charter school's creditors;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(E): the charter school's lease holders;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(F): the charter school's bond issuers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(G): other entities that may have a claim to the charter school's assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(H): the school district in which the charter school is located and other charter schools located in that school district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(i)(I): any other person that the charter school determines to be appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(a)(ii): 63G-30-102 publish notice of the decision for the school district in which the charter school is located, as a class A notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(b): The notice described in Subsection (4)(a) shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(b)(i): the proposed date of the charter school closure;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(b)(ii): the charter school's plans to help students identify and transition into a new school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(4)(b)(iii): contact information for the charter school during the transition.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5): No later than 10 days after the day on which a decision to close a charter school is made, the closing charter school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(a): designate a custodian for the protection of student files and school business records;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(b): designate a base of operation that will be maintained throughout the charter school closing, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(b)(i): an office;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(b)(ii): hours of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(b)(iii): operational telephone service with voice messaging stating the hours of operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(b)(iv): a designated individual to respond to questions or requests during the hours of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(c): assure that the charter school will maintain private insurance coverage or risk management coverage for covered claims that arise before closure, throughout the transition to closure and for a period following closure of the charter school as specified by the charter school's authorizer;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(d): assure that the charter school will complete by the set deadlines for all fiscal years in which funds are received or expended by the charter school a financial audit and any other procedure required by state board rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(e): inventory all assets of the charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(5)(f): list all creditors of the charter school and specifically identify secured creditors and assets that are security interests.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(6): The closing charter school's authorizer shall oversee the closing charter school's compliance with Subsection (5).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7): 53F-9-307; 53G-5-501
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a): Unless a different order is determined by a bankruptcy court under 11 U.S.C. Sec. 1001 et seq., a closing charter school shall distribute the assets of the closing charter school in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(i): return assets donated by a private donor to the private donor if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(i)(A): the assets were donated for a specific purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(i)(B): the private donor restricted use of the assets to only that specific purpose; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(i)(C): the closing charter school has assets that have not been used for the specific purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(ii): distribute assets to satisfy outstanding payroll obligations for employees of the closing charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(iii): distribute assets to creditors of the closing charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(a)(iv): distribute assets to satisfy any outstanding liability or obligation to the state board, state, or federal government.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(b): A closing charter school shall return any assets remaining, after all liabilities and obligations of the closing charter school are paid or discharged consistent with Subsection (7)(a), to the closing charter school's authorizer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(c): Upon receipt of the assets under Subsection (7)(b), the closing charter school's authorizer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(c)(i): liquidate assets at fair market value; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(c)(ii): assign the assets to another public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(7)(d): 53F-9-307; 53G-5-501 The closing charter school's authorizer shall oversee liquidation of assets and payment of liabilities and obligations in accordance with this section, Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(8): The closing charter school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(8)(a): comply with all state and federal reporting requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(8)(b): submit all documentation and complete all state and federal reports required by the closing charter school's authorizer or the state board, including documents to verify the closing charter school's compliance with procedural requirements and satisfaction of all financial issues.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(9): When the closing charter school's financial affairs are closed out and dissolution is complete, the authorizer shall ensure that a final audit of the charter school is completed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(10): The state board shall, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, and after considering suggestions from charter school authorizers, make rules that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(10)(a): provide additional closure procedures for charter schools; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(10)(b): establish a charter school closure process.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11)(a): Upon termination of the charter school's charter agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11)(a)(i): notwithstanding provisions of Title 16, Chapter 6a, Part 14, Dissolution, the nonprofit corporation under which the charter school is organized and managed may be unilaterally dissolved by the authorizer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11)(a)(ii): the net assets of the charter school shall revert to the authorizer as described in Subsection (7).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11)(b): The charter school and the authorizer shall mutually agree in writing on the effective date and time of the dissolution described in Subsection (11)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(11)(c): The effective date and time of dissolution described in Subsection (11)(b) may not exceed five years after the date of the termination of the charter agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12): Notwithstanding the provisions of Chapter 6, Part 5, Charter School Enrollment:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(a): an authorizer may permit a specified number of students from a closing charter school to be enrolled in another charter school, if the receiving charter school:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(a)(i)(A): is authorized by the same authorizer as the closing charter school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(a)(i)(B): is authorized by a different authorizer and the authorizer of the receiving charter school approves the increase in enrollment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(a)(ii): agrees to accept enrollment applications from students of the closing charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(b): a receiving charter school shall give new enrollment preference to applications from students of the closing charter school in the first school year in which the closing charter school is not operational; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(12)(c): a receiving charter school's enrollment capacity is increased by the number of students enrolled in the receiving charter school from the closing charter school under this Subsection (12).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-504(13): A member of the governing board or staff of the receiving charter school that is also a member of the governing board of the receiving charter school's authorizer, shall recuse oneself from a decision regarding the enrollment of students from a closing charter school as described in Subsection (12).


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-505 Tort liability.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-505(1): An employee of a charter school is a public employee and the charter school governing board is a public employer in the same manner as a local school board for purposes of tort liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-505(2): The charter school governing board, the nonprofit corporation under which the charter school is organized and managed, and the school are solely liable for any damages resulting from a legal challenge involving the operation of the school.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(1): "Annual charter school enrollment" means the total enrollment of all students in the state enrolled in a charter school in grades kindergarten through grade 12, based on October 1 enrollment counts.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(2): "Annual state enrollment" means the total enrollment of all students in the state enrolled in a public school in grades kindergarten through grade 12, based on October 1 enrollment counts.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(3): "Authority" means the Utah Charter School Finance Authority created by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(4): 53G-5-602 "Board" means the governing board of the authority described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(5): "Charter school" means a school created under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(6): 53G-5-606 "Credit enhancement program" means the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(7): "Debt service reserve fund" means the reserve fund created or established by, or for the benefit of, a qualifying charter school for the purpose of paying principal of and interest on bonds issued under the credit enhancement program as the payments become due and other money of the qualifying charter school is not available to make the payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(8): "Debt service reserve fund requirement" means, as of a particular date of computation, and with respect to a particular issue of bonds, the amount required to be on deposit in the debt service reserve fund, which amount:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(8)(a): may be a sum certain or as set forth in a formula; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(8)(b): may not be less than the maximum annual debt service requirement for the related bonds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(9): (9)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(9)(a): (9)(b) "Obligations" mean any notes, debentures, revenue bonds, or other evidences of financial indebtedness, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(9)(b): "Obligations" do not include general obligation bonds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(10): "Project" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(10)(a): any building, structure, or property owned, to be acquired, or used by a charter school for any of its educational purposes and the related appurtenances, easements, rights-of-way, improvements, paving, utilities, landscaping, parking facilities, and lands; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(10)(b): any capital equipment owned, to be acquired, or used by a charter school for any of its educational purposes, interests in land, and grounds, together with the personal property necessary, convenient, or appurtenant to them.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(11): "Qualifying charter school" means a charter school that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(11)(a): meets standards adopted by the authority for participation in the credit enhancement program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(11)(b): is designated by the authority as a qualifying charter school for purposes of participation in the credit enhancement program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-601(12): 53F-9-303 "Reserve account" means the Charter School Reserve Account created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602 Utah Charter School Finance Authority created -- Members -- Compensation -- Services.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(1): There is created a body politic and corporate known as the Utah Charter School Finance Authority.  The authority is created to provide an efficient and cost-effective method of financing charter school facilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(2): The governing board of the authority shall be composed of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(2)(a): the governor or the governor's designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(2)(b): the state treasurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(2)(c): the state superintendent or the state superintendent's designee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(3): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(3)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(3)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(3)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-602(4): Upon request, the state board shall provide staff support to the authority.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603 Powers and duties of authority.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(1): The authority shall have perpetual succession as a body politic and corporate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2): Title 11, Chapter 17, Utah Industrial Facilities and Development Act; 53G-5-601; 53G-5-606 The authority may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(a): sue and be sued in its own name;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(b): have, and alter at will, an official seal;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(c): contract with experts, advisers, consultants, and agents for needed services;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(d): receive and accept aid or contributions from any source, including the United States or this state, in the form of money, property, labor, or other things of value to be held, used, and applied to carry out the purposes of this part, subject to the conditions upon which the aid and contributions are made, for any purpose consistent with this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(e): Title 11, Chapter 17, Utah Industrial Facilities and Development Act; 53G-5-601 exercise the powers granted to municipalities and counties pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(e)(i): 53G-5-601 the authority may only exercise powers under the act to finance or refinance a project as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(e)(ii): the authority's area of operation shall include all areas of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(f): employ advisers, consultants, and agents, including financial experts, independent legal counsel, and any advisers, consultants, and agents as may be necessary in its judgment and fix their compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(g): make and execute contracts and other instruments necessary or convenient for the performance of its duties and the exercise of its powers and functions;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(h): 53G-5-606 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(2)(i): have and exercise any other powers or duties that are necessary or appropriate to carry out and effectuate the purposes of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-603(3): 53G-5-607; 53G-5-608; 53G-5-609 Except as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-604 Limited obligations.
----------------------------------------------------
Except as provided in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 53G-5-604(1): do not constitute a debt, moral obligation, or liability of the state, or of any county, city, town, school district, or any other political subdivision of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-604(2): do not constitute the loan of credit of the state or of any county, city, town, school district, or any other political subdivision of the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-604(3): may not be paid from funds other than loan payments or lease revenues received from a charter school or other funds pledged by a charter school.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-605 State to succeed to property of authority when encumbrances paid or authority dissolved.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-605(1): If the authority is dissolved at any time, for any reason, all funds, property, rights, and interests of the authority, following the satisfaction of the authority's obligations, shall immediately vest in and become the property of the state, which shall succeed to all rights of the authority subject to any encumbrances which may then exist on any particular properties.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-605(2): None of the net earnings of the authority shall inure to the benefit of any private person.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606 Charter School Credit Enhancement Program -- Standards for the designation of qualifying charter schools -- Debt service reserve fund requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(1): There is created the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program to assist qualifying charter schools in obtaining favorable financing by providing a means of replenishing a qualifying charter school's debt service reserve fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(2): The authority shall establish standards for a charter school to be designated as a qualifying charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3): (2) In establishing the standards described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3)(a): whether a charter school has received an investment grade rating, independent of any rating enhancement resulting from the issuance of bonds pursuant to the credit enhancement program;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3)(b): the location of the charter school's project;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3)(c): the operating history of the charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3)(d): the financial strength of the charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(3)(e): any other criteria the authority determines are relevant.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(4): (9) The bonds issued by the authority for a qualifying charter school are not an indebtedness of the state or of the authority but are special obligations payable solely from:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(4)(a): the revenues or other funds pledged by the qualifying charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(4)(b): (9) amounts appropriated by the Legislature pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(5): The authority shall notify the authorizer of a charter school that the charter school is participating in the credit enhancement program if the authority:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(5)(a): designates the charter school as a qualifying charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(5)(b): issues bonds for the qualifying charter school under the credit enhancement program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(6): One or more debt service reserve funds shall be established for a qualifying charter school with respect to bonds issued pursuant to the credit enhancement program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(7): (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(7)(a): (7)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(7)(b): So long as the applicable bonds issued under the credit enhancement program remain outstanding, money in a debt service reserve fund may be withdrawn in an amount that would reduce the level of money in the debt service reserve fund to less than the debt service reserve fund requirement if the money is withdrawn for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(7)(b)(i): paying the principal of, redemption price of, or interest on a bond when due and if no other money of the qualifying charter school is available to make the payment, as determined by the authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(7)(b)(ii): paying any redemption premium required to be paid when the bonds are redeemed prior to maturity if no bonds will remain outstanding upon payment from the funds in the qualifying charter school's debt service reserve fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(8): Money in a qualifying charter school's debt service reserve fund that exceeds the debt service reserve fund requirement may be withdrawn by the qualifying charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-606(9):

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-608(1)(b): Nothing in this part precludes an alteration, impairment, or limitation if provision is made by law for the protection of bondholders or persons entering into contracts with a qualifying charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-608(2): The authority may require a qualifying charter school to vest in the authority the right to enforce any covenant made to secure bonds issued under the credit enhancement program by making appropriate provisions in the indenture related to the qualifying charter school's bonds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-608(3): The authority may require a qualifying charter school to make covenants and agreements in indentures or in a reimbursement agreement to protect the interests of the state and to secure repayment to the state of any money received by the qualifying charter school from an appropriation to restore amounts deposited in the qualifying charter school's debt service reserve fund to the debt service reserve fund requirement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-5-608(4): The authority may charge a fee to administer the issuance of bonds for a qualifying charter school.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 53G - Chapter 6 - Participation in Public Schools
*****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Participation in Public Schools."

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(1)(a): "Absence" or "absent" means the failure of a school-age child assigned to a class or class period to attend a class or class period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(1)(b): "Absence" or "absent" does not mean multiple tardies used to calculate an absence for the sake of a truancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(2): 80-1-102 "Educational neglect" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(3)(a): "Home-based microschool" means an individual or association of individuals that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(3)(a)(i): registers as a business entity in accordance with state and local laws; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(3)(a)(ii): for compensation, provides kindergarten through grade 12 education services to 16 or fewer students from an individual's residential dwelling, accessory dwelling unit, or residential property.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(3)(b): "Home-based microschool" does not include a daycare.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(4): "Instructor" means an individual who teaches a student as part of a home-based microschool or micro-education entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(a): "Micro-education entity" means a person or association of persons that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(a)(i): registers as a business entity in accordance with state and local laws; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(a)(ii): for compensation, provides kindergarten through grade 12 education services to 100 students or fewer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(b): "Micro-education entity" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(b)(i): a daycare;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(b)(ii): a home-based microschool;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(b)(iii): a private school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(5)(b)(iv): a school within the public education system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(6): "Minor" means an individual who is under 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(7): "Parent" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(7)(a): a custodial parent of the minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(7)(b): a legally appointed guardian of a minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(7)(c): any other person purporting to exercise any authority over the minor which could be exercised by a person described in Subsection (7)(a) or (b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(8): "School day" means the portion of a day that school is in session in which a school-age child is required to be in school for purposes of receiving instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(9): "School year" means the period of time designated by a local school board or charter school governing board as the school year for the school where the school-age child:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(9)(a): is enrolled; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(9)(b): should be enrolled, if the school-age child is not enrolled in school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(10): "School-age child" means a minor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(10)(a): is at least six years old but younger than 18 years old; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(10)(b): is not emancipated.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(11)(a): "Truant" means a condition in which a school-age child, without a valid excuse, and subject to Subsection (11)(b), is absent for at least:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(11)(a)(i): half of the school day; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(11)(a)(ii): if the school-age child is enrolled in a learner verified program, as that term is defined by the state board, the relevant amount of time under the LEA's policy regarding the LEA's continuing enrollment measure as it relates to truancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(11)(b): A school-age child may not be considered truant under this part more than one time during one day.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(12): 53G-6-202; 53G-6-203 "Truant minor" means a school-age child who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(12)(a): 53G-6-202; 53G-6-203 is subject to the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(12)(b): is truant.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13): 53G-6-803
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a): 53G-6-803 "Valid excuse" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(i): an illness, which may be either mental or physical, regardless of whether the school-age child or parent provides documentation from a medical professional;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(ii): mental or behavioral health of the school-age child;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(iii): a family death;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(iv): an approved school activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(v): an absence permitted by a school-age child's:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(v)(A): individualized education program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(v)(B): Section 504 accommodation plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(vi): 53G-6-803 an absence permitted in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(a)(vii): any other excuse established as valid by a local school board, charter school governing board, or school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-201(13)(b): "Valid excuse" does not mean a parent acknowledgment of an absence for a reason other than a reason described in Subsections (13)(a)(i) through (vi), unless specifically permitted by the local school board, charter school governing board, or school district under Subsection (13)(a)(vi).

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204 School-age children exempt from school attendance.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a): A local school board or charter school governing board may excuse a school-age child from attendance for any of the following reasons:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(i): a school-age child over 16 years old may receive a partial release from school to enter employment, or attend a trade school, if the school-age child has completed grade 8; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(ii): on an annual basis, a school-age child may receive a full release from attending a public, regularly established private, or part-time school or class if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(ii)(A): the school-age child has already completed the work required for graduation from high school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(ii)(B): the school-age child is in a physical or mental condition, certified by a competent physician or physician assistant if required by the local school board or charter school governing board, which renders attendance inexpedient and impracticable;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(ii)(C): proper influences and adequate opportunities for education are provided in connection with the school-age child's employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(a)(ii)(D): the district superintendent or charter school governing board has determined that a school-age child over 16 years old is unable to profit from attendance at school because of inability or a continuing negative attitude toward school regulations and discipline.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(b): A school-age child receiving a partial release from school under Subsection (1)(a)(i) is required to attend:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(b)(i): school part time as prescribed by the local school board or charter school governing board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(b)(ii): a home school part time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(c): In each case, evidence of reasons for granting an exemption under Subsection (1) must be sufficient to satisfy the local school board or charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(1)(d): A local school board or charter school governing board that excuses a school-age child from attendance as provided by this Subsection (1) shall issue a certificate that the child is excused from attendance during the time specified on the certificate.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(d)(iii): inspect home school facilities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(d)(iv): require standardized or other testing of home school students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(e): Upon the request of a parent or legal guardian, a local school board shall identify the knowledge, skills, and competencies a student is recommended to attain by grade level and subject area to assist the parent or legal guardian in achieving college and career readiness through home schooling.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(f): A local school board that excuses a school-age child from attendance under this Subsection (2) shall annually issue a certificate stating that the school-age child is excused from attendance for the specified school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g): A local school board shall issue a certificate excusing a school-age child from attendance:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g)(i): within 30 days after receipt of a signed affidavit filed by the school-age child's parent or legal guardian under this Subsection (2); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g)(ii): on or before August 1 each year thereafter unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g)(ii)(A): the school-age child enrolls in a school within the school district;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g)(ii)(B): the school-age child's parent or legal guardian notifies the school district that the school-age child no longer attends a home school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(2)(g)(ii)(C): the school-age child's parent or legal guardian notifies the school district that the school-age child's school district of residence has changed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(3): 53G-6-202 A parent or legal guardian who is eligible to file and files a signed affidavit under Subsection (2)(a) is exempt from the application of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(4)(a): Nothing in this section may be construed to prohibit or discourage voluntary cooperation, resource sharing, or testing opportunities between a school or school district and a parent or legal guardian of a child attending a home school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(4)(b): The exemptions in this section apply regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(4)(b)(i): a parent or legal guardian provides education instruction to the parent's or legal guardian's child alone or in cooperation with other parents or legal guardians similarly exempted under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-204(4)(b)(ii): the parent or legal guardian makes payment for educational services the parent's or legal guardian's child receives.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-205 Approval absences.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-205(1): In determining whether to preapprove an extended absence of a school-age child as a valid excuse, a local school board, charter school governing board, or school district shall approve the absence if the local school board, charter school governing board, or school district determines that the extended absence will not adversely impact the school-age child's education.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-205(2): A local school board, charter school governing board, or school district may not require documentation from a medical professional to substantiate a valid excuse that is a mental or physical illness.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-207 Truancy specialists.
----------------------------------------------------
A local school board or charter school governing board may appoint and fix the compensation of a truancy specialist to assist in enforcing laws related to school attendance and to perform other duties prescribed by law or the state board.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209 Truancy support centers.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(1): 53G-6-208 A school district may establish one or more truancy support centers for:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(1)(a): 53G-6-208 truant minors taken into custody under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(1)(b): students suspended or expelled from school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(2): A truancy support center shall provide services to the truant minor and the truant minor's family, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(2)(a): assessments of the truant minor's needs and abilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(2)(b): support for the parents and truant minor through counseling and community programs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(2)(c): tutoring for the truant minor during the time spent at the center.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(3): For the suspended or expelled student, the truancy support center shall provide an educational setting, staffed with certified teachers and aides, to provide the student with ongoing educational programming appropriate to the student's grade level.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(4): In a district with a truancy support center, all students suspended or expelled from school shall be referred to the center.  A parent shall appear with the student at the center within 48 hours of the suspension or expulsion, not including weekends or holidays.  The student shall register and attend classes at the truancy support center for the duration of the suspension or expulsion unless the parent demonstrates that alternative arrangements have been made for the education or supervision of the student during the time of suspension or expulsion.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-209(5): The truancy support center may provide counseling and other support programming for students suspended or expelled from school and their parents.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210 Educational neglect of a minor -- Procedures -- Defenses.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(1): 80-3-201; 53G-6-702; 53G-10-202; 53G-10-205; 53G-10-403; 53G-10-203 With regard to a minor who is the subject of a petition under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(1)(d): an allegation of educational neglect may not be sustained, based solely on a minor's absence from school, unless the minor has been absent from school or from any given class, without good cause, for more than 10 consecutive school days or more than 1/10 of the applicable school term.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(2)(b)(iii): there is documentation that the minor has demonstrated educational progress at a level commensurate with the minor's ability;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(2)(b)(iv): the parent, guardian, or other person in control of the minor has made a good faith effort to secure the minor's regular attendance in school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(2)(b)(v): good cause or a valid excuse exists for the minor's absence from school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(2)(b)(vi): the minor is not required to attend school under court order or is exempt under other applicable state or federal law;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-210(2)(b)(vii): the minor has performed above the twenty-fifth percentile of the local public school's age group expectations in all basic skills, as measured by a standardized academic achievement test administered by the school district where the minor resides; or

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(3): The district may require the responsible adult, in addition to the documents set forth in Subsection (2), to also submit any other documents which are relevant to the appointment of a guardian of a minor or which the district reasonably believes to be necessary in connection with a given application to substantiate any claim or assertion made in connection with the application for guardianship.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(4): Upon receipt of the information and documentation required under Subsections (2) and (3), and a determination by the local school board that the information is accurate, that the requirements of this section have been met, and that the interests of the child would best be served by granting the requested guardianship, the local school board or its authorized representative may designate the applicant as guardian of the child by issuing a designation of guardianship letter to the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(5)(a): If a local school board has adopted a policy permitting the local school board to designate a guardian under this section, a denial of an application for appointment of a guardian may be appealed to the district court in which the school district is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(5)(b): The court shall uphold the decision of the local school board unless it finds, by clear and convincing evidence, that the local school board's decision was arbitrary and capricious.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(5)(c): An applicant may, rather than appealing the local school board's decision under Subsection (5)(b), file an original Petition for Appointment of Guardian with the district  court, which action shall proceed as if no decision had been made by the local school board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(6): 75-5-201 A responsible adult obtaining guardianship under this section has the same rights, authority, and responsibilities as a guardian appointed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(7)(a): The school district shall deliver the original documents filed with the school district, together with a copy of the designation of guardianship issued by the district, in person or by any form of mail requiring a signed receipt, to the clerk of the state district court in which the school district is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(7)(b): The court may not charge the school district a fee for filing guardianship papers under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(8)(a): The authority and responsibility of a custodial parent submitting an affidavit under this section may be restored by the district, and the guardianship obtained under this section terminated by the district:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(8)(a)(i): upon submission to the school district in which the guardianship was obtained of a signed and notarized statement by the person who consented to guardianship under Subsection (2)(a) requesting termination of the guardianship; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(8)(a)(ii): by the person accepting guardianship under Subsection (2)(b) requesting the termination of the guardianship.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(8)(b): If the school district determines that it would not be in the best interests of the child to terminate the guardianship, the district may refer the request for termination to the state district court in which the documents were filed under Subsection (5) for further action consistent with the interests of the child.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-303(9): The school district shall retain copies of all documents required by this section  until the child in question has reached 18 years old unless directed to surrender the documents by a court of competent jurisdiction.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-304 Recognition of guardianship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-304(1): A document issued by other than a court of law which purports to award guardianship to a person who is not a legal resident of the jurisdiction in which the guardianship is awarded is not valid in the state of Utah until reviewed and approved by a Utah court.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-304(2): (1); Title 75, Chapter 5, Part 2, Guardians of Minors The procedure for obtaining approval under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305 District paying tuition -- Effect on state aid.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(1): A local school board may by written agreement pay the tuition of a child attending school in a district outside the state.  Both districts shall approve the agreement and file it with the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(2): The average daily membership of the child may be added to that of other eligible children attending schools within the district of residence for the purpose of apportionment of state funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(3): (3)(b)(i); 53F-2-304
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(3)(a): The district of residence shall bear any excess tuition costs over the state's contribution for attendance in the district of residence unless otherwise approved in advance by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(3)(b): (3)(b)(i); 53F-2-304
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(3)(b)(i): If a child who resides in a Utah school district's boundaries attends school in a neighboring state under this section, the state board may make an out-of-state tuition payment to the Utah school district of residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-305(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i); 53F-2-304 If the state board approves the use of state funds for an out-of-state tuition payment described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306 Permitting attendance by nonresident of the state -- Tuition.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(1): 68-3-12.5; 68-3-12.5 As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(1)(d)(i): before the eligible student relocates to the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(1)(d)(ii): after the eligible student's parent relocates out of the state, but before the eligible student relocates out of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(1)(e): 68-3-12.5 "Uniformed services" means:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(2)(b): 53G-6-707 With the exception of a child enrolled under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(3): (3)(a); (3)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(a) The official minutes of the meeting described in Subsection
