Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(4)(a)(ii): provisionally enroll in virtual education options that the LEA provides in the same manner as an individual residing in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(4)(b): An LEA may not require proof of residency from an eligible student at the time the eligible student applies to enroll in a public school in the LEA.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-306(4)(c): An LEA shall require proof of residence within 10 days after the eligible student's first day of residence in the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in SectionsUtah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(1): (1)(b); (1)(b)(i) "Early enrollment" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(1)(a): (1)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(1)(b): (1)(b)(i) application prior to November 1 for admission for the next school year to a school that is not a student's school of residence if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(1)(b)(i): the school district is doing a district wide grade reconfiguration of its elementary, middle, junior, and senior high schools; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i) the grade reconfiguration described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2): (2)(b); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(a): (2)(b) "Early enrollment school capacity" or "maximum capacity" means the total number of students who could be served in a school building if each of the building's instructional stations were to have the enrollment specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(i)(A): for an elementary school, an instructional station shall have an enrollment at least equal to the school district's average class size for the corresponding grade; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(i)(B): for a middle, junior, or senior high school, an instructional station shall have an enrollment at least equal to the district's average class size for similar classes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(ii)(A): A local school board shall determine the instructional station capacity for laboratories, physical education facilities, shops, study halls, self-contained special education classrooms, facilities jointly financed by the school district and another community agency for joint use, and similar rooms.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(2)(b)(ii)(B): Capacity for self-contained special education classrooms shall be based upon students per class as defined by state board and federal special education standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(3)(a): "Instructional station" means a classroom, laboratory, shop, study hall, or physical education facility to which a local school board could reasonably assign a class, teacher, or program during a given class period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(3)(b): More than one instructional station may be assigned to a classroom, laboratory, shop, study hall, or physical education facility during a class period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(4): "Late enrollment" means application:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(4)(a): after the third Friday in February for admission for the next school year to a school that is not the student's school of residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(4)(b): for admission for the current year to a school that is not the student's school of residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(5): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(5)(a): (5)(b) "Late enrollment school capacity" or "adjusted capacity" means the total number of students who could be served in a school if each teacher were to have the class size specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(5)(b)(i): An elementary school teacher shall have a class size at least equal to the district's average class size for the corresponding grade.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(5)(b)(ii): A middle, junior, or senior high school teacher shall have a class size at least equal to the district's average class size for similar classes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(6): "Nonresident student" means a student who lives outside the boundaries of the school attendance area.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7): "Open enrollment threshold" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(a): for early enrollment, a projected school enrollment level that is the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(a)(i): 90% of the maximum capacity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(a)(ii): maximum capacity minus 40 students; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(b): for late enrollment, actual school enrollment that is the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(b)(i): 90% of adjusted capacity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(7)(b)(ii): adjusted capacity minus 40 students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(8): "Projected school enrollment" means the current year enrollment of a school as of October 1, adjusted for projected growth for the next school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(9): "School attendance area" means an area established by a local school board from which students are assigned to attend a certain school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-401(10): "School of residence" means the school to which a student is assigned to attend based on the student's place of residence.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402 Open enrollment options -- Procedures -- Processing fee -- Continuing enrollment.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(1): 53G-6-407; 53B-8-102 Each local school board is responsible for providing educational services consistent with Utah state law and rules of the state board for each student who resides in the district and, as provided in this section through Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(2)(a): A school is open for enrollment of nonresident students if the enrollment level is at or below the open enrollment threshold.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(2)(b): If a school's enrollment falls below the open enrollment threshold, the local school board shall allow a nonresident student to enroll in the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(3): A local school board may allow enrollment of nonresident students in a school that is operating above the open enrollment threshold.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4): 53G-6-401; 53G-6-401
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(a): A local school board shall adopt policies describing procedures for nonresident students to follow in applying for entry into the district's schools.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b): 53G-6-401; 53G-6-401 Those procedures shall provide, as a minimum, for:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(i): distribution to interested parties of information about the school or school district and how to apply for admission;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(ii): use of standard application forms prescribed by the state board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(iii): 53G-6-401
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(iii)(A): submission of applications from November 15 through the first Friday in February by those seeking admission during the early enrollment period for the following year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(iii)(B): 53G-6-401 submission of applications from August 1 through November 1 by those seeking admission during the early enrollment period for the following year in a school district described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(iv): submission of applications by those seeking admission during the late enrollment period;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(v): notwithstanding any other provision of this part or Part 3, School District Residency, submission of applications for at least 30 days after the day on which a school boundary change takes effect for those affected by the school boundary change;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vi): written notification to the student's parent of acceptance or rejection of an application:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vi)(A): within six weeks after receipt of the application by the district or by March 31, whichever is later, for applications submitted during the early enrollment period;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vi)(B): within two weeks after receipt of the application by the district or by the Friday before the new school year begins, whichever is later, for applications submitted during the late enrollment period for admission in the next school year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vi)(C): within two weeks after receipt of the application by the district, for applications submitted during the late enrollment period for admission in the current year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vi)(D): within two weeks after receipt of the application by the district, for applications submitted by students affected by a school district boundary change;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(vii): written notification to the resident school for intradistrict transfers or the resident district for interdistrict transfers upon acceptance of a nonresident student for enrollment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(viii): 53G-6-401 written notification to the parents of each student that resides within the school district and other interested parties of the revised early enrollment period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(viii)(A): the school district is doing a district wide grade reconfiguration of its elementary, middle, junior, and senior high schools; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(b)(viii)(B): the grade reconfiguration described in Subsection (4)(b)(viii)(A) will be implemented in the next school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c)(i): Notwithstanding the dates established in Subsection (4)(b) for submitting applications and notifying parents of acceptance or rejection of an application, a local school board may delay the dates if a local school board is not able to make a reasonably accurate projection of the early enrollment school capacity or late enrollment school capacity of a school due to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c)(i)(A): school construction or remodeling;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c)(i)(B): drawing or revision of school boundaries; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c)(i)(C): other circumstances beyond the control of the local school board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(4)(c)(ii): The delay may extend no later than four weeks beyond the date the local school board is able to make a reasonably accurate projection of the early enrollment school capacity or late enrollment school capacity of a school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(5): A school district may charge a one-time $5 processing fee, to be paid at the time of application.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6): 53B-8-102 An enrolled nonresident student shall be permitted to remain enrolled in a school, subject to the same rules and standards as resident students, without renewed applications in subsequent years unless one of the following occurs:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(a): the student graduates;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(b): the student is no longer a Utah resident;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(c): the student is suspended or expelled from school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(d): except for a student described in Subsection (6)(e), the district determines that enrollment within the school will exceed the school's open enrollment threshold; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(e): 53B-8-102 for a child of a military service member, as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(e)(i): in kindergarten through grade 10, the student completes the current school year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(6)(e)(ii): in grades 11 and 12, the student graduates.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(7)(a): Determination of which nonresident students will be excluded from continued enrollment in a school during a subsequent year under Subsection (6)(d) is based upon time in the school, with those most recently enrolled being excluded first and the use of a lottery system when multiple nonresident students have the same number of school days in the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(7)(b): Nonresident students who will not be permitted to continue their enrollment shall be notified no later than March 15 of the current school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(8): The parent of a student enrolled in a school that is not the student's school of residence may withdraw the student from that school for enrollment in another public school by submitting notice of intent to enroll the student in:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(8)(a): the district of residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(8)(b): another nonresident district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(9): Unless provisions have previously been made for enrollment in another school, a nonresident district releasing a student from enrollment shall immediately notify the district of residence, which shall enroll the student in the resident district and take such additional steps as may be necessary to ensure compliance with laws governing school attendance.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(10)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (10)(c), a student who transfers between schools, whether effective on the first day of the school year or after the school year has begun, by exercising an open enrollment option under this section may not transfer to a different school during the same school year by exercising an open enrollment option under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(10)(b): The restriction on transfers specified in Subsection (10)(a) does not apply to a student transfer made for health or safety reasons.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(10)(c): A local school board may adopt a policy allowing a student to exercise an open enrollment option more than once in a school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(11): Notwithstanding Subsections (2) and (6)(d), a student who is enrolled in a school that is not the student's school of residence, because school bus service is not provided between the student's neighborhood and school of residence for safety reasons:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(11)(a): shall be allowed to continue to attend the school until the student finishes the highest grade level offered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(11)(b): shall be allowed to attend the middle school, junior high school, or high school into which the school's students feed until the student graduates from high school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-402(12): Notwithstanding any other provision of this part or Part 3, School District Residency, a student shall be allowed to enroll in any charter school or other public school in any district, including a district where the student does not reside, if the enrollment is necessary, as determined by the Division of Child and Family Services, to comply with the provisions of 42 U.S.C. Section 675.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403 Policies for acceptance and rejection of applications.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(1): 53G-6-402; (1)(a); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(1)(a): 53G-6-402 A local school board shall adopt policies governing acceptance and rejection of applications required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(1)(b): (1)(a); (2) The policies adopted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2): Standards for accepting or rejecting an application for enrollment may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(a): for an elementary school, the capacity of the grade level;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(b): for a secondary school, the capacity of a comprehensive program;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(c): maintenance of heterogeneous student populations if necessary to avoid violation of constitutional or statutory rights of students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(d): not offering, or having capacity in, an elementary or secondary special education or other special program the student requires;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(e): maintenance of reduced class sizes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(e)(i): in a Title I school that uses federal, state, and local money to reduce class sizes for the purpose of improving student achievement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(e)(ii): in a school that uses school trust money to reduce class size;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(f): willingness of prospective students to comply with district policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(2)(g): giving priority to intradistrict transfers over interdistrict transfers.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a): (3)(b) Standards for accepting or rejecting applications for enrollment may not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a)(i): previous academic achievement;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a)(ii): athletic or other extracurricular ability;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a)(iii): the fact that the student requires special education services for which space is available;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a)(iv): proficiency in the English language; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(a)(v): (3)(b) previous disciplinary proceedings, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b): A local school board may provide for the denial of applications from students who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b)(i): have committed serious infractions of the law or school policies, including policies of the district in which enrollment is sought; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b)(ii): have been guilty of chronic misbehavior which would, if it were to continue after the student was admitted:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b)(ii)(A): endanger persons or property;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b)(ii)(B): cause serious disruptions in the school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(b)(ii)(C): place unreasonable burdens on school staff.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(3)(c): A local school board may also provide for provisional enrollment of students with prior behavior problems, establishing conditions under which enrollment of a nonresident student would be permitted or continued.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(4)(a): The state board, in consultation with the Utah High School Activities Association, shall establish policies regarding nonresident student participation in interscholastic competition.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(4)(b): (4)(a) Nonresident students shall be eligible for extracurricular activities at a public school consistent with eligibility standards as applied to students that reside within the school attendance area, except as provided by policies established under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5): For each school in the district, the local school board shall post on the school district's website:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(a): the school's maximum capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(b): the school's adjusted capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(c): the school's projected enrollment used in the calculation of the open enrollment threshold;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(d): actual enrollment on October 1, January 2, and April 1;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(e): the number of nonresident student enrollment requests;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(f): the number of nonresident student enrollment requests accepted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-403(5)(g): the number of resident students transferring to another school.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-404 Denial of enrollment -- Appeal.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-404(1): Denial of initial or continuing enrollment in a nonresident school may be appealed to the local school board of the nonresident district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-404(2): The decision of the local school board shall be upheld in any subsequent proceedings unless the local school board's decision is found, by clear and convincing evidence, to be in violation of applicable law or regulation, or to be arbitrary and capricious.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405 Funding.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(1): A student who enrolls in a nonresident district is considered a resident of that district for purposes of state funding.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(2): (2)(a) The state board shall adopt rules providing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(2)(a): the resident district pay the nonresident district, for each of the resident district's students who enroll in the nonresident district, 1/2 of the amount by which the resident district's per student expenditure exceeds the value of the state's contribution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(2)(b): (2)(a) if a student is enrolled in a nonresident district for less than a full year, the resident district shall pay a portion of the amount specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3): (3); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(a): (3) Except as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b): The state board may adopt rules under which a nonresident student may be transported to the student's school of attendance if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b)(i): transportation relieves overcrowding or other serious problems in the district of residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b)(ii): the district of residence lacks sufficient transportation services;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b)(iii): the costs of transportation are reasonable;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b)(iv): there is available space on an approved route within the student's school of attendance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(b)(v): the Legislature has granted an adequate specific appropriation for that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(c): Nothing in this section shall be construed as prohibiting the resident district or the receiving district from providing bus transportation on any approved route.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-405(3)(d): (3)(b) Except as provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-406 Graduation credits.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-406(1): A nonresident district shall accept credits toward graduation that were awarded by a school accredited or approved by the state board or a regional accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-406(2): A nonresident district shall award a diploma to a nonresident student attending school within the district during the semester immediately preceding graduation if the student meets graduation requirements generally applicable to students in the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-406(3): A district may not require that a student attend school within the district for more than one semester prior to graduation in order to receive a diploma.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407 Intradistrict transfers for students impacted by boundary changes -- Transportation of students who transfer within a district.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(1)(a): In adjusting school boundaries, a local school board shall strive to avoid requiring current students to change schools and shall, to the extent reasonably feasible, accommodate parents who wish to avoid having their children attend different schools of the same level because of boundary changes which occur after one or more children in the family begin attending one of the affected schools.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(1)(b): In granting interdistrict and intradistrict transfers to a particular school, the local school board shall take into consideration the fact that an applicant's brother or sister is attending the school or another school within the district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(2): 53F-2-402; 53F-2-403
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(2)(a): 53F-2-402; 53F-2-403 A district shall receive transportation money under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-407(2)(b): The parent of the student shall arrange for the student's transportation to and from school, except that the district shall provide transportation on the basis of available space on an approved route within the district to the school of the student's attendance if the student would be otherwise eligible for transportation to the same school from that point on the bus route and the student's presence does not increase the cost of the bus route.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(1): 53G-6-302 As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(4)(b): A school district shall report to a charter school, by the last business day of each month, the aggregate number of students enrolled in the charter school who have accepted enrollment in the school district in the following school year, sorted by grade level.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(5): When a vacancy occurs because a student has withdrawn from a charter school, the charter school may immediately enroll a new student from its list of applicants.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(6): Unless provisions have previously been made for enrollment in another school, a charter school releasing a student from enrollment during a school year shall immediately notify the school district of residence, which shall enroll the student in the school district of residence and take additional steps as may be necessary to ensure compliance with laws governing school attendance.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(7): (2)(a); (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(7)(a): The parent of a student enrolled in a charter school may withdraw the student from the charter school for enrollment in the student's school of residence in the following school year if an application of admission is submitted to the school district of residence by June 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(7)(b): If the parent of a student enrolled in a charter school submits an application of admission to the student's school district of residence after June 30 for the student's enrollment in the school district of residence in the following school year, or an application of admission is submitted for enrollment during the current school year, the student may enroll in a school of the school district of residence that has adequate capacity in:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(7)(b)(i): the student's grade level, if the student is an elementary school student; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-503(7)(b)(ii): the core classes that the student needs to take, if the student is a secondary school student.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702 Dual enrollment.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(1): 53G-6-201 As used in this section, "minor" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(2): A person having control of a minor who is enrolled in a regularly established private school or a home school may also enroll the minor in a public school for dual enrollment purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(3): The minor may participate in any academic activity in the public school available to students in the minor's grade or age group, subject to compliance with the same rules and requirements that apply to a full-time student's participation in the activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(4)(a): A student enrolled in a dual enrollment program in a district school is considered a student of the district in which the district school of attendance is located for purposes of state funding to the extent of the student's participation in the district school programs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(4)(b): A student enrolled in a dual enrollment program in a charter school is considered a student of the charter school for purposes of state funding to the extent of the student's participation in the charter school programs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-702(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704 Charter school students' participation in extracurricular activities at other public schools.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(1): 53G-7-1101; 53G-7-501; 53G-6-703 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(1)(a): 53G-7-1101 "Association" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(1)(b): 53G-7-501 "Extracurricular activity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(1)(c): 53G-6-703 "Initial establishment of eligibility requirements" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(2): A charter school student is eligible to participate in an extracurricular activity not offered by the student's charter school at:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(2)(a): the school with attendance boundaries within which the student's custodial parent resides, if, for an interscholastic competition of athletic teams, the student did not initially establish the student's eligibility at another public school in grade 9 or 10;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(2)(b): the public school from which the student withdrew for the purpose of attending a charter school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(2)(c): a public school that is not a charter school if the student's charter school is located on the campus of the public school or has local school board approval to locate on the campus of the public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(3): (2); (2) In addition to the public schools listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(4): (2); Part 4, School District Enrollment A school other than a school described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(4)(a): for interschool competitions of athletic teams, the charter school student meets the initial establishment of eligibility requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(4)(b): for interschool contests or competitions for music, drama, or forensic groups or teams, the charter school student meets the entry requirements for participation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(4)(c): the charter school student meets the eligibility requirements under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(4)(d): Part 4, School District Enrollment the charter school student meets the enrollment requirements for public school in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(5): A charter school student is eligible for an extracurricular activity at a public school consistent with eligibility standards as applied to full-time students of the public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(6): A school district or a public school may not impose additional requirements on a charter school student to participate in an extracurricular activity that are not imposed on full-time students of the public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7): 53G-7-504; (7)(b)(iii); (iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(a): The state board shall make rules establishing fees for charter school students' participation in an extracurricular activity at school district schools.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(b): 53G-7-504 The rules shall provide that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(b)(i): charter school students pay the same fees as other students to participate in an extracurricular activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(b)(ii): 53G-7-504 charter school students are eligible for fee waivers pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(b)(iii): for each charter school student who participates in an extracurricular activity at a school district school, the charter school shall pay a share of the school district's costs for the extracurricular activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(b)(iv): a charter school's share of the costs of an extracurricular activity shall reflect state and local tax revenues expended, except capital facilities expenditures, for an extracurricular activity in a school district or a school divided by total student enrollment of the school district or the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(7)(c): (7)(b)(iii); (iv) In determining a charter school's share of the costs of an extracurricular activity under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-704(8): When selection to participate in an extracurricular activity at a public school is made on a competitive basis, a charter school student is eligible to try out for and participate in the activity as provided in this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705 Online students' participation in extracurricular activities.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(1): 53G-7-1101; 53G-7-501; 53G-6-703; 53F-2-102(4) As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(1)(d): "Online education" means the use of information and communication technologies to deliver educational opportunities to a student in a location other than a school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(1)(e): 53F-2-102(4) "Online student" means a student who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(1)(e)(i): participates in an online education program sponsored or supported by the state board, a school district, or a charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(1)(e)(ii): 53F-2-102(4) generates funding for the school district or the school pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(2): An online student is eligible to participate in an extracurricular activity at:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(2)(a): the school with attendance boundaries within which the student's custodial parent resides, if, for an interscholastic competition of athletic teams, the student did not initially establish the student's eligibility at another public school in grade 9 or 10; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(2)(b): the public school from which the student withdrew for the purpose of participating in an online education program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(3): (2); Part 4, School District Enrollment A public school other than a school described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(3)(a): for interschool competitions of athletic teams sponsored and supported by a public school, the online school student meets the initial establishment of eligibility requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(3)(b): for interschool contests or competitions for music, drama, or forensic groups or teams sponsored and supported by a public school, the online school student meets the entry requirements for participation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(3)(c): the online school student meets the eligibility requirements under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(3)(d): Part 4, School District Enrollment the online school student meets the enrollment requirements for public school in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(4): An online student is eligible to participate in an extracurricular activity at a public school consistent with eligibility standards as applied to full-time students of the public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(5): A school district or public school may not impose additional requirements on an online school student to participate in an extracurricular activity that are not imposed on full-time students of the public school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6): 53G-7-504; (6)(b)(iii); (iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(a): The state board shall make rules establishing fees for an online school student's participation in an extracurricular activity at school district schools.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(b): 53G-7-504 The rules shall provide that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(b)(i): online school students pay the same fees as other students to participate in an extracurricular activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(b)(ii): 53G-7-504 online school students are eligible for fee waivers pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(b)(iii): for each online school student who participates in an extracurricular activity at a school district school, the online school shall pay a share of the school district's costs for the extracurricular activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-705(6)(b)(iv): an online school's share of the costs of an extracurricular activity shall reflect state and local tax revenues expended, except capital facilities expenditures, for an extracurricular activity in a school district or school divided by total student enrollment of the school district or school.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706 Placement of a student of a home school, micro-education entity, or home-based microschool, who transfers to a public school.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(1): 53G-6-201 For the purposes of this section, "parent" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(2): When a home school student, a home-based microschool student, or a micro-education entity student transfers from a home school, a home-based microschool, or a micro-education entity to a public school, the public school shall place the student in the grade levels, classes, or courses that the student's parent and the school administrator determine are appropriate based on the parent's assessment of the student's academic performance.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(a): Within 30 days of the student's placement in a public school grade level, class, or course, either the student's teacher or the student's parent may request a conference to consider changing the student's placement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(b): If the student's teacher and the student's parent agree on a placement change, the public school shall place the student in the agreed upon grade level, class, or course.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(c): If the student's teacher and the student's parent do not agree on a placement change, the public school shall evaluate the student's subject matter mastery in accordance with Subsection (3)(d).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(d): The student's parent has the option of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(d)(i): allowing the public school to administer, to the student, assessments that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(d)(i)(A): regularly administered to public school students; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(d)(i)(B): used to measure public school students' subject matter mastery and determine placement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(d)(ii): having a private entity or individual administer assessments of subject matter mastery to the student at the parent's expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(3)(e): After an evaluation of a student's subject matter mastery, a public school may change the student's placement in a grade level, class, or course.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(4): 53G-6-702 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(4)(a): home school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(4)(b): home-based microschool; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-706(4)(c): micro-education entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707 Interstate compact students -- Inclusion in attendance count -- Foreign exchange students -- Annual report -- Requirements for exchange student agencies.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(1): Title 80, Chapter 2, Part 9, Interstate Compact on Placement of Children A school district or charter school may include the following students in the district's or school's membership and attendance count for the purpose of apportionment of state money:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(1)(a): a student enrolled under an interstate compact, established between the state board and the state education authority of another state, under which a student from one compact state would be permitted to enroll in a public school in the other compact state on the same basis as a resident student of the receiving state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(1)(b): Title 80, Chapter 2, Part 9, Interstate Compact on Placement of Children a student receiving services under
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(2): A school district or charter school may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(2)(a): enroll foreign exchange students that do not qualify for state money; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(2)(b): pay for the costs of those students with other funds available to the school district or charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(3): (2) Due to the benefits to all students of having the opportunity to become familiar with individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures, school districts are encouraged to enroll foreign exchange students, as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4): 76-5-406(2)(j)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(a): A local school board or charter school governing board shall require each approved exchange student agency to provide it with a sworn affidavit of compliance prior to the beginning of each school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b): 76-5-406(2)(j) The affidavit shall include the following assurances:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(i): that the agency has complied with all applicable policies of the state board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(ii): that a household study, including a background check of all adult residents, has been made of each household where an exchange student is to reside, and that the study was of sufficient scope to provide reasonable assurance that the exchange student will receive proper care and supervision in a safe environment;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(iii): 76-5-406(2)(j) that host parents have received training appropriate to their positions, including information about enhanced criminal penalties under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(iv): that a representative of the exchange student agency shall visit each student's place of residence at least once each month during the student's stay in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(v): that the agency will cooperate with school and other public authorities to ensure that no exchange student becomes an unreasonable burden upon the public schools or other public agencies;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(vi): that each exchange student will be given in the exchange student's native language names and telephone numbers of agency representatives and others who could be called at any time if a serious problem occurs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(4)(b)(vii): that alternate placements are readily available so that no student is required to remain in a household if conditions appear to exist which unreasonably endanger the student's welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(5)(a): A local school board or charter school governing board shall provide each approved exchange student agency with a list of names and telephone numbers of individuals not associated with the agency who could be called by an exchange student in the event of a serious problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-707(5)(b): The agency shall make a copy of the list available to each of its exchange students in the exchange student's native language.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709 Participation of students with a disability in extracurricular activities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709(1): A student with a disability may not be denied the opportunity of participating in a public school program or extracurricular activity solely because of the student's age or disability, unless the participation threatens the health or safety of the student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709(2): The school district or charter school, in cooperation with the Utah Department of Health shall establish criteria used to determine the health and safety factor.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709(3): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709(3)(a): has not graduated from high school with a regular diploma; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-709(3)(b): is under the age of 22, if participation is recommended by the student's individualized education program team.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803 Parental right to academic accommodations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(a): A student's parent is the primary person responsible for the education of the student, and the state is in a secondary and supportive role to the parent.  As such, a student's parent has the right to reasonable academic accommodations from the student's LEA as specified in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(b): Each accommodation shall be considered on an individual basis and no student shall be considered to a greater or lesser degree than any other student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(c): The parental rights specified in this section do not include all the rights or accommodations that may be available to a student's parent as a user of the public education system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(d): An accommodation under this section may only be provided if the accommodation is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(d)(i): consistent with federal law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(1)(d)(ii): consistent with a student's IEP if the student already has an IEP.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(2): An LEA shall reasonably accommodate a parent's written request to retain a student in kindergarten through grade 8 on grade level based on the student's academic ability or the student's social, emotional, or physical maturity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(3): An LEA shall reasonably accommodate a parent's initial selection of a teacher or request for a change of teacher.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(4): An LEA shall reasonably accommodate the request of a student's parent to visit and observe any class the student attends.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(5): Part 2, Compulsory Education Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(5)(a): the parent submits a written statement at least one school day before the scheduled absence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(5)(b): the student agrees to make up course work for school days missed for the scheduled absence in accordance with LEA policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(6): (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(6)(a): An LEA shall reasonably accommodate a parent's written request to place a student in a specialized class, a specialized program, or an advanced course.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(6)(b): (6)(a) An LEA shall consider multiple academic data points when determining an accommodation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(7): 53E-4-204 Consistent with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(7)(a): testing out of the course; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(7)(b): demonstrating competency in course standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-803(8): An LEA shall reasonably accommodate a parent's request to meet with a teacher at a mutually agreeable time if the parent is unable to attend a regularly scheduled parent teacher conference.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-804(2)(a): to the parent of a student enrolled in the online course, access to the learning management system, including, at a minimum:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-804(2)(b)(i): the learning management system;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-804(2)(b)(ii): the online course; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-804(2)(b)(iii): any online tools used to deliver the online course or instruction.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-901 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-901(1): "Coed" or "mixed" means that a team is composed of members of both sexes who traditionally compete together.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-901(2): "Interscholastic athletic activity" means that a student represents the student's school or LEA in competition against another school or LEA in an athletic or sporting activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-901(3): "Sex" means the biological, physical condition of being male or female, determined by an individual's genetics and anatomy at birth.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-903 Severability.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-903(1): If any provision of this part or the application of any provision of this part to any person or circumstance is held invalid by a final decision of a court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this part shall be given effect without the invalidated provision or application.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-903(2): The provisions of this part are severable.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-904 Indemnification -- Enforcement.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-904(1): The attorney general shall defend and the state shall indemnify and hold harmless a person acting under color of state law to enforce this part for any claims or damages, including court costs and attorney fees, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-904(1)(a): arise as a result of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-904(1)(b): are not covered by the person's insurance policies or by any coverage agreement issued by the State Risk Management Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-904(2): An LEA or school within the public education system with a team that competes in an interscholastic athletic activity is responsible for the enforcement of this part in relation to the LEA's or school's teams.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004 Eligibility for interscholastic activities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1)(a): Notwithstanding any state board rule or policy of an athletic association, and except as provided in Subsections (1)(b) and (c):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1)(a)(i): once a student has obtained the eligibility approval of the commission under Subsection (2), the student may participate in a gender-designated interscholastic activity that does not correspond with the sex designation on the student's birth certificate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1)(a)(ii): if a student does not obtain the eligibility approval of the commission under Subsection (2), the student may not participate in a gender-designated interscholastic activity that does not correspond with the sex designation on the student's birth certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1)(b): A student who has undergone or is undergoing a gender transition shall obtain the eligibility approval of the commission under Subsection (2) to participate in a gender-designated interscholastic activity that corresponds with the student's gender identity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(1)(c): Nothing in this subsection prohibits a student from participating in a gender-designated interscholastic activity in accordance with 34 C.F.R. Sec. 106.41(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2): 53G-6-1003
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a): 53G-6-1003 When a student registers with an athletic association to participate in a gender-designated interscholastic activity:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a)(i): a student who has undergone or is undergoing a gender transition shall notify the athletic association of the student's transition and the need for the commission's eligibility approval as described in Subsection (1)(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a)(ii): 53G-6-1003 the athletic association shall notify the commission of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a)(ii)(A): a student for whom an eligibility determination of the commission is required due to the sex designation on the student's birth certificate not corresponding with the gender designation of the gender-designated interscholastic activity in which the student seeks to participate or the student's notice of a gender transition under Subsection (1)(a)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a)(ii)(B): 53G-6-1003 the association's ad hoc appointment to the commission described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(a)(iii): the athletic association shall notify the student described in Subsection (2)(a) regarding the process for determining the student's eligibility for the activity under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(b): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(b)(i): schedule a non-public meeting to consider a student's eligibility to be held within 30 days after the day on which the commission receives the notification described in Subsection (2)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(b)(ii): notify the relevant athletic association and the student's parents or legal guardians of the scheduled meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c): Before the meeting described in Subsection (2)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(i): the student for whom the commission has scheduled the meeting or the student's parent or guardian is not required but may submit to the commission any information the student wishes to disclose to the commission that may be relevant to the commission's eligibility determination, including information regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(i)(A): the gender-designated interscholastic activities for which the student seeks eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(i)(B): the gender-designated interscholastic activities in which the student has previously participated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(i)(C): the student's physical characteristics or medical treatments that support the student's eligibility for the specific gender-designated interscholastic activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(ii): the commission may request additional evidence from the student that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(ii)(A): limited to the extent possible to protect the student's privacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(ii)(B): only directly relevant to the commission's eligibility determination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(iii): the commission may offer the student a voucher to cover the cost of a diagnostic assessment if the commission makes a request for medical information under Subsection (2)(c)(ii) for which the student's insurance does not provide coverage or reimbursement for the diagnostic that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(iii)(A): would provide the requested information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(c)(iii)(B): is not free or otherwise readily available to the student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d): During the meeting described in Subsection (2)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(i): only the following individuals may be present or participate electronically:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(i)(A): the student for whom the commission is meeting to make an eligibility determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(i)(B): the student's parents or guardians;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(i)(C): the members and necessary staff of the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(i)(D): any medical professionals or other witnesses the student chooses to include to support the student's eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(ii): attendees may participate in person or electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(iii): the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(iii)(A): hear the information that supports the student's eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(iii)(B): deliberate the facts relevant to the student's physical characteristics and eligibility in camera or otherwise after temporarily excusing from the meeting the student, the student's parents or legal guardians, and any medical professionals or other witnesses whom the student includes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(d)(iii)(C): render the commission's eligibility determination in accordance with Subsection (3) or request additional information and schedule an additional commission meeting to be held within 30 days of the meeting and in accordance with this Subsection (2)(d) to discuss the additional information and render the commission's eligibility determination.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(2)(e): The commission may not address the commission's application or analysis of or determination under this part regarding the eligibility of a specific student in a public meeting or public communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3): 34A-5-102; 53G-6-1003
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(a): 34A-5-102; 53G-6-1003 In making an eligibility determination, the commission, after considering whether the student's assertion of a gender identity is consistent with the statutory definition of gender identity as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(a)(i): 53G-6-1003 make a determination regarding whether, when measured against the relevant baseline range described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(a)(i)(A): present a substantial safety risk to the student or others that is significantly greater than the inherent risks of the given activity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(a)(i)(B): likely give the student a material competitive advantage when compared to students of the same age competing in the relevant gender-designated activity, including consideration of the student's previous history of participation in gender-designated interscholastic activities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(a)(ii): record the commission's decision and rationale in writing and provide the written decision to the athletic commission within 30 days after the day on which the commission renders an eligibility decision under Subsection (3)(a) in a meeting described in Subsection (2)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(b): Upon receipt of the commission's determination and rationale under Subsection (3)(a), the athletic commission shall notify the student and the relevant school or LEA of the commission's determination and rationale.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(3)(c): A school or LEA shall comply with the commission's determination under this Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(4):

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(4)(b): The commission shall disclose the commission's determination of a student's eligibility for a given gender-designated interscholastic activity to the relevant athletic association, only for the purpose of confirming whether the student is eligible for the interscholastic activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(4)(c):

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1004(4)(c)(ii): Nothing in this Subsection (4) prohibits an athletic association from affirming that a student is eligible if the eligibility of a student is questioned.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1005 Reasonable accommodations.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this part prohibits an athletic association, LEA, or school from adopting reasonable safety and privacy rules and policies that designate facilities, including restrooms, shower facilities, and dressing facilities, provided that the rules and policies described in this section afford reasonable accommodations based on gender identity to all students.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1006 Severability.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1006(1): If any provision of this part or the application of any provision of this part to any person or circumstance is held invalid by a final decision of a court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this part shall be given effect without the invalidated provision or application.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1006(2): The provisions of this part are severable.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007 Indemnification -- Enforcement.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007(1): The attorney general shall defend and the state shall indemnify and hold harmless a person acting under color of state law to enforce this part for any claims or damages, including court costs and attorney fees, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007(1)(a): arise as a result of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007(1)(b): are not covered by the person's insurance policies or by any coverage agreement issued by the State Risk Management Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007(2): An LEA or school within the public education system with a team that competes in an interscholastic athletic activity is responsible for the enforcement of this part in relation to the LEA's or school's teams.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007 Indemnification -- Enforcement.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1007(1): The attorney general shall defend and the state shall indemnify and hold harmless a person acting under color of state law to enforce this part for any claims or damages, including court costs and attorney fees, that:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101 Report -- Action plan.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(1)(a): "Gender-designated interscholastic sport" means a sport that is specifically designated for female or male students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(1)(b): "Interscholastic sport" means an activity in which a student represents the student's school in the sport in competition against another school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(1)(c): "School" means a public school that sponsors or offers an interscholastic sport in which students enrolled at the school may participate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(1)(d): "Title IX" means Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, 20 U.S.C. Sec. 1681 et seq.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2): Before the beginning of each academic year, the athletic director or another administrator of each school shall report to the school's local governing board regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(a): the number and type of interscholastic sports available at the school, categorized by gender designation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(b): the number of students competing in a gender-designated interscholastic sport at the school, categorized by gender;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(c): the amount of spending that the school devotes to each gender-designated sport, reported in total amount and on a per-student basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(d): a comparison and evaluation of designated practice and game locations in gender-designated interscholastic sports;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(e): any information regarding the school's efforts in compliance with Title 63G, Chapter 31, Part 2, Distinctions on the Basis of Sex, and Title IX; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(2)(f): if there is a discrepancy between male-designated and female-designated sports of 10% or greater, an action plan that the school develops to address the discrepancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-6-1101(3): An LEA governing board that receives the report described in Subsection (2) shall review the report in a public board meeting.

--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Public School General Requirements."

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-201 Definitions.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202 Waivers from state board rules.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202(1): A charter school or any other public school or school district may apply to the state board for a waiver of any state board rule that inhibits or hinders the school or the school district from accomplishing its mission or educational goals set out in its strategic plan or charter agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202(2): The state board may grant the waiver, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202(2)(a): the waiver would cause the school district or the school to be in violation of state or federal law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202(2)(b): the waiver would threaten the health, safety, or welfare of students in the district or at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-202(3): If the state board denies the waiver, the reason for the denial shall be provided in writing to the waiver applicant.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203 Kindergartens -- Establishment -- Funding -- Assessment.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(1): Kindergartens are an integral part of the state's public education system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2): 53G-6-702
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(a): Each LEA governing board shall provide kindergarten classes free of charge for kindergarten children residing within the district or attending the charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b): Each LEA governing board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(i): provide a half-day kindergarten option for a student that comprises the minimum standards for half-day kindergarten that the state board establishes, in accordance with Subsection (4)(a)(iii), if the student's parent requests a half-day option; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(ii)(A): inform parents of the availability of the option to register for a designated full-curriculum half-day kindergarten option at the time of all kindergarten registration, by email, posters, or other announcements when a parent requests kindergarten registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(ii)(B): provide the option to register for a designated half-day kindergarten option at the time of registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(iii): provide a dedicated kindergarten class specifically designated as a half-day kindergarten class when enrollment of half-day kindergarten students at an individual school or a regional school exceeds a minimum of 18 students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(iv): when enrollment of half-day kindergarten students at an individual school exceeds a minimum of 18 students, designate the school as a half-day kindergarten provider for the improvement of recruiting teachers that prefer half-day teaching;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(v): inform parents regarding the additional educational resources and opportunities available to parents who select the half-day kindergarten option; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(b)(vi): ensure that a half-day kindergarten student who is registered in a class that includes full-day kindergarten students receives instruction that at least meets the minimum standards for half-day kindergarten that the state board establishes, in accordance with Subsection (4)(a)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-203(2)(c): 53G-6-702 Nothing in this Subsection (2):

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205 Assessment of emerging and early reading skills -- Resources provided by school districts.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(1): The Legislature recognizes that well-developed reading skills help:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(1)(a): children to succeed in school, develop self esteem, and build positive relationships with others;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(1)(b): young adults to become independent learners; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(1)(c): adults to become and remain productive members of a rapidly changing technology-based society.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(2)(a): Each potential kindergarten student, the student's parent, and kindergarten personnel at the student's school may participate in an assessment of the student's reading and numeric skills.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-205(2)(b): The state board, in cooperation with the state's school districts, may develop the assessment instrument and any additional materials needed to implement and supplement the assessment program.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206 Acceptance of credits and grades awarded by accredited schools.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(1)(a): A public school shall accept credits and grades awarded to a student by a school accredited or approved by the state board or accredited or recognized by the Northwest Association of Accredited Schools as issued by the school, without alterations.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(1)(b): Credits awarded for a core standards for Utah public schools course shall be applied to fulfilling core standards for Utah public schools requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(2): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(2)(a): transfers to a public school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(2)(b): while enrolled in the public school, takes courses offered by another public or private school.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(3)(a): traditional classes in which an instructor is present in the classroom and the student is required to attend the class for a particular length of time;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(3)(b): open entry/open exit classes in which the student has the flexibility to begin or end study at any time, progress through course material at his own pace, and demonstrate competency when knowledge and skills have been mastered;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(3)(c): courses offered over the Internet; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-206(3)(d): distance learning courses.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-207 Period of silence.
--------------------------------------------------
A teacher may provide for the observance of a period of silence each school day in a public school.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213 Child care centers in public schools -- Requirements -- Availability -- Compliance with state and local laws.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(1)(a): Upon receiving a request from a community group such as a community council, local PTA, or parent/student organization, a local school board may authorize the use of a part of any school building in the district to provide child care services for school aged children.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(1)(b)(i): The local school board shall provide written public notice of its intent to authorize a child care center.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(1)(b)(ii): The local school board shall file a copy of the notice with the Office of Child Care within the Department of Workforce Services and the Department of Health.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(2)(a): Establishment of a child care center in a public school building is contingent upon the local school board determining that the center will not interfere with the building's use for regular school purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(2)(b): The decision shall be made at the sole discretion of the local school board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(2)(c): A local school board may withdraw its approval to operate a child care center at any time if it determines that such use interferes with the operation or interest of the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(2)(d): The school district and its employees and agents are immune from any liability that might otherwise result from a withdrawal of approval if the withdrawal was made in good faith.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(3)(a): The local school board shall charge a commercially reasonable fee for the use of a school building as a child care center so that the district does not incur an expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(3)(b): The fee shall include but not be limited to costs for utility, building maintenance, and administrative services supplied by the school that are related to the operation of the child care center.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(4)(a): Child care service may be provided by governmental agencies other than school districts, nonprofit community service groups, or private providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(4)(b): (4)(a) If competitive proposals to provide child care services are submitted by the entities listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(4)(c): It is intended that these programs function at the local community level with minimal state and district involvement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(5): It is the intent of the Legislature that providers not be required to go through a complex procedure in order to obtain approval for providing the service.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(6)(a): Child care centers within a public school building shall make their services available to all children regardless of where the children reside.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(6)(b): If space and resources are limited, first priority shall be given to those who reside within the school boundaries where the center is located, and to the children of teachers and other employees of the school where the child care center is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(6)(c): Second priority shall be given to those who reside within the school district boundaries where the center is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(7): Title 63A, Chapter 4, Risk Management
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(7)(a): The local school board shall require proof of liability insurance which is adequate in the opinion of the local school board for use of school property as a child care center.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(7)(b): Title 63A, Chapter 4, Risk Management A school district participating in the state Risk Management Fund shall require the provider of child care services to comply with the applicable provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(8): Child care centers established under this section shall operate in compliance with state and local laws and regulations, including zoning and licensing requirements, and applicable school policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-213(9): (8) Except for Subsection

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(a): left high school before graduating in order to serve in the armed forces of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(b): served in the armed forces of the United States during the period of World War II, the Korean War, or the Vietnam War;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(c)(i): was honorably discharged; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(c)(ii): was released from active duty because of a service-related disability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(d)(i): resides within the school district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(1)(d)(ii): resided within the school district at the time of leaving high school to serve in the armed forces of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(2): (1) To receive an honorary high school diploma, a veteran or immediate family member or guardian of a veteran shall submit to a local school board:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(2)(a): a request for an honorary high school diploma; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(2)(b): (1) information required by the local school board to verify the veteran's eligibility for an honorary high school diploma under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-214(3): (1)(b); (c) At the request of a veteran, a veteran's immediate family member or guardian, or a local school board, the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs shall certify whether the veteran meets the requirements of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215 Personalized, competency-based learning -- Recommendations -- Coordination.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(1): 53F-5-501 As used in this section, "personalized, competency-based learning" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(2): A local school board or a charter school governing board may establish a personalized, competency-based learning program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3): A local school board or charter school governing board that establishes a personalized, competency-based learning program shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3)(a): establish assessments to accurately measure competency;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3)(b): provide the assessments to an enrolled student at no cost to the student;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3)(c): award credit to a student who demonstrates competency and subject mastery;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3)(d): submit the competency-based standards to the state board for review; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(3)(e): publish the competency-based standards on its website or by other electronic means readily accessible to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4): A local school board or charter school governing board may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4)(a): on a random lottery-based basis, limit enrollment to courses that have been designated as competency-based courses;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4)(b): waive or adapt traditional attendance requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4)(c): adjust class sizes to maximize the value of course instructors or course mentors;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4)(d): enroll students from any geographic location within the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-215(4)(e): provide proctored online competency-based assessments.
