Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223 Policy supporting students learning English, parents, and families.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(1): An LEA shall adopt a policy addressing the LEA's communication and assistance to students learning English, their parents, and their families.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2): The policy shall provide:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a): guidance on the appropriate use of an interpreter and recommended interpreter qualifications, including certification or education-specific experience, for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(i): classroom activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(ii): impromptu and scheduled office visits or phone calls;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(iii): enrollment or registration processes;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(iv): the IEP process;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(v): student educational and occupational planning processes;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(vi): fee waiver processes;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(vii): parent engagement activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(viii): student disciplinary meetings;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(ix): school community councils;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(x): school board meetings;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(xi): other school or LEA activities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(a)(xii): other interactions between the parents of a student learning English and educational staff;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b): guidance on the appropriate use of a translator or interpreter for the translation or interpretation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(i): registration or enrollment materials, including home language surveys and English learning program entrance and exit notifications;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(ii): assignments and accompanying materials;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(iii): report cards or other progress reports;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(iv): student discipline policies and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(v): grievance procedures and notices of rights and nondiscrimination;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(vi): parent or family handbooks; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(b)(vii): requests for parent permission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(2)(c): any other guidance, including guidance on when oral interpretation is preferable to written translation, to improve instruction and assistance by teachers, counselors, and administrators to a student learning English and the student's parents and family.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(3): The state board shall provide to an LEA notification of LEA requirements described in this section, a model of the policy described in this section, and guidance and technical assistance regarding existing requirements in relevant statute, administrative rule, and federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-223(4): On or before July 1, 2023, the state board shall provide to the Education Interim Committee a funding projection for annual and one-time costs associated with an LEA's implementation of the policy described in this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224 Local education agency communication requirements -- Protection.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(1): 53G-8-510 As used in this section, "school employee" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(2): On or before October 1 of each year, an LEA shall provide the state board with the work email address of each school employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(3): The state board may email school employees for official communication:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(3)(a): if the state board provides 48 hours notice to the local superintendent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(3)(b): no more than three times per calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(4): The state board:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(4)(a): may use an employee's email address provided under Subsection (2) for official communication between the state board and the school employee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(4)(b): may not disclose an email address provided under Subsection (2) to a third party.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(a): Upon request, the state board shall provide the email addresses in Subsection (2) to the president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(b): The president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives, by mutual agreement, may jointly email school employees for official communication on behalf of the Legislature relating to the teaching profession or education policy in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(b)(i): if the president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives provide 48 hours notice to the local superintendent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(b)(ii): no more than three times per calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(c): The president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(c)(i): use or allow another individual to use a school employee's email address for political activity or for any purpose other than as described in Subsection (5)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-224(5)(c)(ii): disclose and email address provided under Subsection (2) to another legislator or a third party.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225 Use of overhead spray irrigation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(a): "Active recreation area" means an area of school property that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(a)(i): dedicated to active use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(a)(ii): installed or maintained on an area with a slope of not more than 25%.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(b): "Active use" means regular use for playing, exercise, recreation, or regular outdoor activities, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(b)(i): a sports field;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(b)(ii): a social gathering area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(b)(iii): an amphitheater.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c): "Great Salt Lake basin" means the area within:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(i): the surveyed meander line of the Great Salt Lake;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(ii): the drainage areas of the Bear River or the Bear River's tributaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(iii): the drainage areas of Bear Lake or Bear Lake's tributaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(iv): the drainage areas of the Weber River or the Weber River's tributaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(v): the drainage areas of the Jordan River or the Jordan River's tributaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(vi): the drainage areas of Utah Lake or Utah Lake's tributaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(vii): other water drainages lying between the Bear River and the Jordan River that are tributary to the Great Salt Lake and not included in the drainage areas described in Subsections (1)(c)(ii) through (vi); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(c)(viii): the drainage area of Tooele Valley.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(d): "Landscaped area" means those portions of school property that are not, or will not be, occupied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(d)(i): a permanent structure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(d)(ii): an impervious surface associated with vehicular or pedestrian access or use, such as a driveway, sidewalk, or parking lot.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(e): "LEA" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(e)(i): a school district;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(e)(ii): a charter school, other than an online-only charter school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(e)(iii): the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(f): "New construction" means a project for the construction of a public facility on school property that includes a new or modified landscaped area of more than 7,500 square feet.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(g): "Overhead spray irrigation" means above ground irrigation heads that spray water through a nozzle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(h): "Parkstrip" means the area between the back of a curb or, if there is no curb, the edge of pavement and the sidewalk.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(i): "Public facility" means a building, structure, infrastructure, improvement, sports field, playground, or other facility of an LEA.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(j): "Reconstruction" means a project for the renovation, alteration, improvement, or repair of a public facility on school property that affects more than 25% of the landscaped area existing before the reconstruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(1)(k): "School property" means real property owned by an LEA.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(a): An LEA with school property within the Great Salt Lake basin that undertakes new construction or reconstruction on the school property on or after May 1, 2024, may not install, maintain, or use overhead spray irrigation in a landscaped area of the school property unless the landscaped area is an active recreation area.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(b): An LEA may not install, maintain, or use overhead spray irrigation to irrigate the following within an active recreation area described in Subsection (2)(a):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(b)(i): a park strip;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(b)(ii): an area with a width of less than eight feet; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(b)(iii): in an area that is a planting bed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(2)(c): An LEA may not treat school property as an active recreation area if the area is sized larger than reasonably required for the anticipated use the area is intended to accommodate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(3): Nothing in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(3)(a): requires an LEA to submit a land use application to a municipality or county to landscape school property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(3)(b): authorizes a municipality or county to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(3)(b)(i): impose landscaping requirements on school property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-225(3)(b)(ii): require an LEA to obtain approval for landscaping on school property.

--------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302 School district and charter school budgets.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(a): "Budget officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(a)(i): for a school district, the school district's superintendent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(a)(ii): for a charter school, an individual selected by the charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(b): "LEA governing board" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(b)(i): for a school district, the local school board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(1)(b)(ii): for a charter school, the charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(2): Before June 1 of each year, the budget officer shall prepare a tentative budget, with supporting documentation, to be submitted to the budget officer's LEA governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3): The tentative budget and supporting documents shall include the following items:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3)(a): the revenues and expenditures of the preceding fiscal year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3)(b): the estimated revenues and expenditures of the current fiscal year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3)(c): for a school district, an estimate of the revenues for the succeeding fiscal year based upon the lowest tax levy that will raise the required revenue, using the current year's taxable value as the basis for this calculation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3)(d): a detailed estimate of the essential expenditures for all purposes for the next succeeding fiscal year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(3)(e): the estimated financial condition of the school district or charter school by funds at the close of the current fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-302(4): The tentative budget shall be filed with the district business administrator or charter school executive director for public inspection at least 15 days before the date of the tentative budget's proposed adoption by the LEA governing board.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-304 Undistributed reserve in local school board budget.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-304(1): A local school board may adopt a budget with an undistributed reserve. The reserve may not exceed 5% of the maintenance and operation budget adopted by the local school board in accordance with a scale developed by the state board.  The scale is based on the size of the school district's budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-304(2): The local school board may appropriate all or a part of the undistributed reserve made to any expenditure classification in the maintenance and operation budget by written resolution adopted by a majority vote of the local school board setting forth the reasons for the appropriation.  The local school board shall file a copy of the resolution with the state board and the state auditor.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-304(3): The local school board may not use undistributed reserves in the negotiation or settlement of contract salaries for school district employees.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305 Limits on appropriations -- Estimated expendable revenue.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(a): "Budget officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(a)(i): for a school district, the school district's superintendent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(a)(ii): for a charter school, an individual selected by the charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(b): "LEA governing board" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(b)(i): for a school district, the local school board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(1)(b)(ii): for a charter school, the charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(2): An LEA governing board may not make an appropriation in excess of its estimated expendable revenue, including undistributed reserves, for the following fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(3): An LEA governing board may reduce a budget appropriation at the LEA governing board's regular meeting if notice of the proposed action is given to all LEA governing board members and to the district superintendent or charter school executive director, as applicable, at least one week before the meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(4): For a school district, in determining the estimated expendable revenue, any existing deficits arising through excessive expenditures from former years are deducted from the estimated revenue for the ensuing year to the extent of at least 10% of the entire tax revenue of the district for the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(5): For a school district, in the event of financial hardships, the local school board may deduct from the estimated expendable revenue for the ensuing year, by fund, at least 25% of the deficit amount.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(6): For a school district, all estimated balances available for appropriations at the end of the fiscal year shall revert to the funds from which they were appropriated and shall be fund balances available for appropriation in the budget of the following year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7): 45-1-101 For a school district, an increase in an appropriation may not be made by the local school board unless the following steps are taken:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7)(a): the local school board receives a written request from the district superintendent that sets forth the reasons for the proposed increase;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7)(b): 45-1-101 notice of the request is published:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7)(b)(i): in a newspaper of general circulation within the school district at least one week before the local school board meeting at which the request will be considered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7)(b)(ii): 45-1-101 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-305(7)(c): the local school board holds a public hearing on the request before the local school board's acting on the request.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306 School district interfund transfers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(1): A school district shall spend revenues only within the fund for which they were originally authorized, levied, collected, or appropriated.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(2): Except as otherwise provided in this section, school district interfund transfers of residual equity are prohibited.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(3): The state board may authorize school district interfund transfers of residual equity when a district states its intent to create a new fund or expand, contract, or liquidate an existing fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(4): 53G-7-305 The state board may also authorize school district interfund transfers of residual equity for a financially distressed district if the state board determines the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(4)(a): the district has a significant deficit in its maintenance and operations fund caused by circumstances not subject to the administrative decisions of the district;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(4)(b): 53G-7-305 the deficit cannot be reasonably reduced under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(4)(c): without the transfer, the school district will not be capable of meeting statewide educational standards adopted by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The state board shall develop by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(6): 59-2-924(5); 59-2-919; 53G-7-303
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(6)(a): All debt service levies not subject to certified tax rate hearings shall be recorded and reported in the debt service fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(6)(b): 59-2-924(5); 59-2-919 Debt service levies under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(6)(c): Amounts from these levies remaining in the debt service fund at the end of a fiscal year shall be used in subsequent years for general obligation debt retirement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-306(6)(d): 53G-7-303 Any amounts left in the debt service fund after all general obligation debt has been retired may be transferred to the capital projects fund upon completion of the budgetary hearing process required under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-308 Emergency expenditures.
-------------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to appropriations required because of emergencies involving loss of life or great loss of property.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(1): "Audit committee" means a standing committee:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(1)(a): appointed by the local school board or charter school governing board with the following number of members as applicable to the local school board or charter school governing board:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(1)(a)(i): for a board of a local education agency that consists of seven or more members, three members of that board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(1)(a)(ii): for a board of a local education agency that consists of six or fewer members, two members of that board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(1)(b): composed of people who are not administrators or employees of the local education agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(2): "Audit director" means the person who directs the internal audit program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(3): "Audit plan" means a prioritized list of audits to be performed by an internal audit program within a specified period of time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(4): "Internal audit" means an independent appraisal activity established within a local education agency as a control system to examine and evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of other internal control systems within the local education agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5): "Internal audit program" means an audit function that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5)(a): is conducted by a local school board or charter school governing board independent of the local education agency offices or other operations;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5)(b): objectively evaluates the effectiveness of the local education agency governance, risk management, internal controls, and the efficiency of operations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5)(c): is conducted in accordance with the current:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5)(c)(i): International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(5)(c)(ii): The Government Auditing Standards, issued by the Comptroller General of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-401(6): "Local education agency" means a school district or charter school.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402 Internal auditing program -- Audit committee -- Powers and duties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(1): A local school board or charter school governing board shall establish an audit committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(2)(a): The audit committee shall establish an internal audit program that provides internal audit services for the programs administered by the local education agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(2)(b): (2)(a) A local education agency that has fewer than 10,000 students is not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(3)(a): A local school board or charter school governing board shall appoint the audit director, with the advisement of the audit committee, if the local school board or charter school governing board hires an audit director.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(3)(b): If the local school board or charter school governing board has not appointed an audit director and the local school board or charter school governing board contracts directly for internal audit services, the local school board or charter school governing board shall approve a contract for internal audit services, with the advisement of the audit committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(4): The audit committee shall ensure that copies of all reports of audit findings issued by the internal auditors are available, upon request, to the audit director of the state board, the Office of the State Auditor, and the Office of Legislative Auditor General.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(5): The audit committee shall ensure that significant audit matters that cannot be appropriately addressed by the local education agency internal auditors are referred to either the audit director of the state board, the Office of the State Auditor, or the Office of Legislative Auditor General.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(6): The audit director may contract with a consultant to assist with an audit.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-402(7): The audit director of the state board and the Office of the State Auditor may contract to provide internal audit services.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1): "Co-curricular activity" means an activity, a course, or a program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1)(a): is an extension of a curricular activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1)(b): is included in an instructional plan and supervised or conducted by a teacher or education professional;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1)(c): is conducted outside of regular school hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1)(d): is provided, sponsored, or supported by an LEA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(1)(e): includes a required regular school day activity, course, or program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(2): "Curricular activity" means an activity, a course, or a program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(2)(a): is intended to deliver instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(2)(b): is provided, sponsored, or supported by an LEA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(2)(c): is conducted only during school hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(3): "Elementary school" means a school that provides instruction to students in grades kindergarten, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(4)(a): "Elementary school student" means a student enrolled in an elementary school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(4)(b): "Elementary school student" does not include a secondary school student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5): 53G-7-701
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5)(a): "Extracurricular activity" means an activity, a course, or a program that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5)(a)(i): not directly related to delivering required instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5)(a)(ii): not a curricular activity or co-curricular activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5)(a)(iii): provided, sponsored, or supported by an LEA.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(5)(b): 53G-7-701 "Extracurricular activity" does not include a noncurricular club as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6): 53G-8-212
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(a): "Fee" means a charge, expense, deposit, rental, or payment:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(a)(i): regardless of how the charge, expense, deposit, rental, or payment is termed, described, requested, or required directly or indirectly;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(a)(ii): in the form of money, goods, or services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(a)(iii): that is a condition to a student's full participation in an activity, course, or program that is provided, sponsored, or supported by an LEA.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b): "Fee" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b)(i): charges or expenditures for a school field trip or activity trip, including related transportation, food, lodging, and admission charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b)(ii): payments made to a third party that provides a part of a school activity, class, or program;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b)(iii): charges or expenditures for classroom instructional equipment or supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b)(iv): charges or expenditures for school activity clothing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(b)(v): a fine other than a fine described in Subsection (6)(c)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c): 53G-8-212 "Fee" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(i): 53G-8-212 a student fine specifically approved by an LEA for:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(i)(A): failing to return school property;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(i)(B): 53G-8-212 losing, wasting, or damaging private or school property through intentional, careless, or irresponsible behavior, or as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(i)(C): improper use of school property, including a parking violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(ii): a payment for school breakfast or lunch;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(iii): a deposit that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(iii)(A): a pledge securing the return of school property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(iii)(B): refunded upon the return of the school property;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(iv): a charge for insurance, unless the insurance is required for a student to participate in an activity, course, or program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(6)(c)(v): money or another item of monetary value raised by a student or the student's family through fundraising.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(7)(a): "Fundraising" means an activity or event provided, sponsored, or supported by an LEA that uses students to generate funds or raise money to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(7)(a)(i): provide financial support to a school or a school's class, group, team, or program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(7)(a)(ii): benefit a particular charity or for other charitable purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(7)(b): "Fundraising" does not include an alternative method of raising revenue without students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8)(a): "Instructional equipment or supplies" means an activity-, course-, or program-related supply or tool that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8)(a)(i): a student is required to use as part of an activity, course, or program in a secondary school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8)(a)(ii): becomes the property of the student upon exiting the activity, course, or program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8)(a)(iii): is subject to a fee waiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(8)(b): "Instructional equipment or supplies" does not include school equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a): "School activity clothing" means special shoes or items of clothing:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a)(i)(A): that meet specific requirements, including requesting a specific brand, fabric, or imprint;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a)(i)(B): that a school requires a student to provide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a)(i)(C): that become the property of the student upon exiting the activity, course, or program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(a)(ii): that are required to be worn by a student for an activity-, course-, or a program-related activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(b): "School activity clothing" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(b)(i): a school uniform; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(9)(b)(ii): clothing that is commonly found in students' homes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10): "School equipment" means a machine, equipment, facility, or tool that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10)(a): is durable;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10)(b): is reusable;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10)(c): is consumable;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10)(d): is owned by a secondary school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(10)(e): a student uses as part of an activity, course, or program in a secondary school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(a): "School uniform" means special shoes or an item of clothing:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(a)(i)(A): that meet specific requirements, including a requested specific color, style, fabric, or imprint; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(a)(i)(B): that a school requires a student to provide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(a)(ii): that is worn by a student for a curricular activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(11)(b): "School uniform" does not include school activity clothing.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(12): "Secondary school" means a school that provides instruction to students in grades 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, or 12.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(13): "Secondary school student":
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(13)(a): means a student enrolled in a secondary school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(13)(b): includes a student in grade 6 if the student attends a secondary school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14)(a): "Textbook" means instructional material necessary for participation in an activity, course, or program, regardless of the format of the material.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14)(b): "Textbook" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14)(b)(i): a hardcopy book or printed pages of instructional material, including a consumable workbook; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14)(b)(ii): computer hardware, software, or digital content.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(14)(c): "Textbook" does not include instructional equipment or supplies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-501(15): "Waiver" means a full release from a requirement to pay a fee and from any provision in lieu of fee payment.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-502 Schools to be free.
---------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in this public education code, the public education system shall be free to an individual:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-502(1): between five and 18 years old who is a resident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-502(2): over 18 years old who is domiciled in the state of Utah and has not completed requirements for a high school diploma.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503 Fees -- Prohibitions -- Voluntary supplies -- Enforcement -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(5): An LEA may not charge a fee, except as provided in Subsection (3)(c):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(5)(a): for school equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(5)(b): that is general in nature and for a service or good that does not have a direct benefit to the student paying the fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(6): An LEA governing board shall authorize each fee individually.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(7)(a): If an LEA imposes a fee under this part, the fee shall be equal to or less than the expense incurred by the LEA in providing for a student the activity, course, or program for which the LEA imposes the fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(7)(b): An LEA may not impose an additional fee or increase a fee to supplant or subsidize another fee, including a fee to supplant or subsidize an expense that the LEA incurs for:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(7)(b)(i): a curricular activity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(7)(b)(ii): an expense for the portion of a co-curricular activity that occurs during regular school hours.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(8)(b): withholding state funds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(8)(c): suspending the LEA's authority to charge fees for an amount of time specified by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(9): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the state board shall make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(9)(a): that require notice and an opportunity to be heard for an LEA affected by a state board action described in this Subsection (9); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-503(9)(b): to administer this Subsection (9).


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504 Waiver of fees -- Appeal of decision.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(1): 53G-7-505
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(1)(a): Subject to the provisions of this part, if an LEA or a school within an LEA charges one or more fees, the LEA shall grant a waiver to a student if charging the fee would deny the student the opportunity to fully participate or complete a requirement because of an inability to pay the fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(1)(b): 53G-7-505 An LEA governing board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(1)(b)(i): adopt policies for granting a waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(1)(b)(ii): 53G-7-505 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2)(a): An LEA that charges a fee under this part may provide a variety of alternatives for a student or family to satisfy a fee requirement, including allowing a student to provide:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2)(a)(i): tutorial assistance to other students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2)(a)(ii): assistance before or after school to teachers and other school personnel on school related matters; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2)(a)(iii): general community or home service.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(2)(b): Each LEA governing board may add to the list of alternatives provided by the state board, subject to approval by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(3): With regard to a student who is in the custody of the Division of Child and Family Services who is also eligible under Title IV-E of the federal Social Security Act, an LEA governing board shall require fee waivers or alternatives in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(4): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the state board shall make rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(4)(a): requiring a parent of a student applying for a fee waiver to provide documentation and certification to the school verifying:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(4)(a)(i): the student's eligibility to receive the waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(4)(a)(ii): if applicable, that the student has complied with alternatives for satisfying the fee requirements under Subsection (2) to the fullest extent reasonably possible according to the individual circumstances of the student and the LEA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(4)(b): specifying the acceptable forms of documentation for the requirement under Subsection (4)(a), which shall include verification based on income tax returns or current pay stubs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(5): Notwithstanding the requirements under Subsection (4), an LEA is not required to keep documentation on file after the verification is completed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(6): If a school denies a student or parent request for a fee waiver, the school shall provide the student or parent:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(6)(a): the school's written decision to deny a waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-504(6)(b): the procedure to appeal in accordance with LEA policy.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505 Approval and notice of student fees and waivers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(1): An LEA governing board shall annually:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(1)(a): adopt fee policies and a fee schedule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(1)(b): provide the fee schedule to each student and parent.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(2): For the fee schedule, the LEA governing board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(2)(a): before approving the fee schedule, provide at least two opportunities for the public to comment on the proposed fee schedule;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(2)(b): encourage public participation in the development of the fee schedule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(2)(c): approve the fee schedule in a regularly scheduled public meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a): The fee schedule shall include the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(i): a specific amount for each fee on the fee schedule;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(ii): if a student is responsible for multiple fees related to one activity, class, or program, a clear and easy to understand delineation of each fee and the fee total for each activity, class, or program;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(iii): the LEA's fee waiver policy, including an easily understandable statement informing a parent that a student:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(iii)(A): may be eligible to have one or more fees waived; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(iii)(B): may appeal the LEA's decision if the LEA denies a request for a fee waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(a)(iv): a corresponding spending plan for each fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(b): The LEA shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(b)(i): publish the fee schedule on each of the LEA's school's websites; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-505(3)(b)(ii): include a copy of the LEA's fee schedule with the LEA's registration materials.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506 State policy on providing free textbooks.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506(1): It is the public policy of this state that public education shall be free.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506(2): A student may not be denied an education because of economic inability to purchase textbooks necessary for advancement in or graduation from the public school system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506(3): 53E-10-302; 53G-7-504
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506(3)(a): 53E-10-302 Beginning with the 2024-2025 school year, an LEAmay only charge a fee for a textbook required for an Advanced Placement, International Baccalaureate, or, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-506(3)(b): 53G-7-504 The LEA shall waive a fee described in Subsection (3)(a) in full if a student qualifies for a waiver in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-507 Purchase of textbooks -- Textbooks provided to teachers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-507(1): An LEA governing board may purchase textbooks directly from the textbook publisher at prices and terms approved by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-507(2): An LEA governing board shall purchase each textbook necessary for a teacher to conduct the teacher's class.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-507(3): An LEA may pay the LEA's cost of furnishing textbooks from school operating funds, the textbook fund, or from other available funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-507(4): A textbook remains the property of the LEA.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(1): 53G-10-203 "Bigotry" means action or advocacy of imminent action involving:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(1)(a): the harassment or denigration of a person or entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(1)(b): 53G-10-203 any intent to cause a person not to freely enjoy or exercise any right secured by the constitution or laws of the United States or the state, except that an evaluation or prohibition may not be made of the truth or falsity of any religious belief or expression of conscience unless the means of expression or conduct arising therefrom violates the standards of conduct outlined in this section, Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(2): "Club" means any student organization that meets during noninstructional time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(3): "Conscience" means a standard based upon learned experiences, a personal philosophy or system of belief, religious teachings or doctrine, an absolute or external sense of right and wrong which is felt on an individual basis, a belief in an external absolute, or any combination of the foregoing.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(4): "Curricular club" means a club that is school sponsored and that may receive leadership, direction, and support from the school or school district beyond providing a meeting place during noninstructional time.  An elementary school curricular club means a club that is organized and directed by school sponsors at the elementary school.  A secondary school curricular club means a club:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(4)(a): whose subject matter is taught or will soon be taught in a regular course;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(4)(b): whose subject matter concerns the body of courses as a whole;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(4)(c): in which participation is required for a particular course; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(4)(d): in which participation results in academic credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(5)(a): "Discretionary time" means school-related time for students that is not instructional time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(5)(b): "Discretionary time" includes free time before and after school, during lunch and between classes or on buses, and private time before athletic and other events or activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(6)(a): "Encourage criminal or delinquent conduct" means action or advocacy of imminent action that violates any law or administrative rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(6)(b): "Encourage criminal or delinquent conduct" does not include discussions concerning changing of laws or rules, or actions taken through lawfully established channels to effectuate such change.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(7)(a): "Instructional time" means time during which a school is responsible for a student and the student is required or expected to be actively engaged in a learning activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(7)(b): "Instructional time" includes instructional activities in the classroom or study hall during regularly scheduled hours, required activities outside the classroom, and counseling, private conferences, or tutoring provided by school employees or volunteers acting in their official capacities during or outside of regular school hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(8): 53G-10-402; 53E-9-203 "Involve human sexuality" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(8)(a): 53G-10-402; 53E-9-203 presenting information in violation of laws governing sex education, including Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(8)(b): advocating or engaging in sexual activity outside of legally recognized marriage or forbidden by state law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(8)(c): presenting or discussing information relating to the use of contraceptive devices or substances, regardless of whether the use is for purposes of contraception or personal health.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(9): "LEA governing board" means a local school board or charter school governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(10): 53G-10-203(2)(b) "Limited open forum" means a forum created by a school district or charter school for student expression within the constraints of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(11): "Noncurricular club" is a student initiated group that may be authorized and allowed school facilities use during noninstructional time in secondary schools by a school and LEA governing board in accordance with the provisions of this part.  A noncurricular club's meetings, ideas, and activities are not sponsored or endorsed in any way by an LEA governing board, the school, or by school or school district employees.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(12): "Noninstructional time" means time set aside by a school before instructional time begins or after instructional time ends, including discretionary time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(13): "Religious club" means a noncurricular club designated in its application as either being religiously based or based on expression or conduct mandated by conscience.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(14): "School" means a public school, including a charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(15)(a): "School facilities use" means access to a school facility, premises, or playing field.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-701(15)(b): "School facilities use" includes access to a limited open forum.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702 Student clubs -- Limited open forum -- Authorization.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(1)(a): A school may establish and maintain a limited open forum for student clubs pursuant to the provisions of this part, state board rules, and LEA governing board policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(1)(b): (1)(a) Notwithstanding the provisions under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2)(a): A school shall review applications for authorization of clubs on a case-by-case basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2)(b): Before granting an authorization, the school shall find:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2)(b)(i): that the proposed club meets this part's respective requirements of a curricular club or a noncurricular club; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2)(b)(ii): that the proposed club's purpose and activities comply with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(2)(c): Before granting an authorization, a school may request additional information from the faculty sponsor, from students proposing the club, or from its LEA governing board, if desired.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-702(3): A school shall grant authorization and school facilities use to curricular and noncurricular clubs whose applications are found to meet the requirements of this part, rules of the state board, and policies of the LEA governing board and shall limit or deny authorization or school facilities use to proposed clubs that do not meet the requirements of this part, rules of the state board, and policies of the LEA governing board.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703 Curricular clubs -- Authorization.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(1): Faculty members or students proposing a curricular club shall submit written application for authorization on a form approved by the LEA governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(2): An LEA governing board may exempt a club whose membership is determined by student body election or a club that is governed by an association that regulates interscholastic activities from the authorization requirements under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3): 53G-7-709 An application for authorization of a curricular club shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(a): the recommended club name;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(b): a statement of the club's purpose, goals, and activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c): 53G-7-709 a statement of the club's categorization, which shall be included in the parental consent required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(i): athletic;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(ii): business/economic;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(iii): agriculture;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(iv): art/music/performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(v): science;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(vi): gaming;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(vii): religious;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(viii): community service/social justice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(c)(ix): other;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(d): the recommended meeting times, dates, and places;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(e): a statement that the club will comply with the provisions of this part and all other applicable laws, rules, or policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(3)(f): a budget showing the amount and source of any funding provided or to be provided to the club and its proposed use.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(4): The application may be as brief as a single page so long as it contains the items required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(5): A school shall approve the name of a curricular club consistent with the club's purposes and its school sponsorship.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6)(a): A school shall determine curriculum relatedness by strictly applying this part's definition of curricular club to the club application.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6)(b): If the school finds that the proposed club is a curricular club, the school shall continue to review the application as an application for authorization of a curricular club.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6)(c): If the school finds that the proposed club is a noncurricular club, the school may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6)(c)(i): return the application to the faculty member or students proposing the club for amendment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(6)(c)(ii): review the application as an application for authorization of a noncurricular club.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(7)(a): Only curricular clubs may be authorized for elementary schools.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-703(7)(b): A school governing body may limit, or permit a secondary school to limit, the authorization of clubs at the secondary school to only curricular clubs.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704 Noncurricular clubs -- Annual authorization.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(1): A noncurricular club shall have a minimum of three members.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(2): Students proposing a noncurricular club shall submit a written application for authorization on a form approved by the LEA governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3): 53G-7-709 An application for authorization of a noncurricular club shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(a): the recommended club name;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(b): a statement of the club's purpose, goals, and activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c): 53G-7-709 a statement of the club's categorization, which shall be included in the parental consent required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(i): athletic;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(ii): business/economic;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(iii): agriculture;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(iv): art/music/performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(v): science;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(vi): gaming;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(vii): religious;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(viii): community service/social justice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(c)(ix): other;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(d): the recommended meeting times, dates, and places;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(e): a statement that the club will comply with the provisions of this part and all other applicable laws, rules, or policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(3)(f): a budget showing the amount and source of any funding provided or to be provided to the club and its proposed use.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(4): The application may be as brief as a single page so long as it contains the items required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(5)(a): An LEA governing board may provide for approval of a noncurricular club name in an action separate from that relating to authorization of the club itself.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(5)(b): An LEA governing board shall require:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(5)(b)(i): that a noncurricular club name shall reasonably reflect the club's purpose, goals, and activities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-704(5)(b)(ii): that the noncurricular club name shall be a name that would not result in or imply a violation of this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705 Clubs -- Limitations and denials.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1): A school shall limit or deny authorization or school facilities use to a club, or require changes prior to granting authorization or school facilities use:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a): as the school determines it to be necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(i): protect the physical, emotional, psychological, or moral well-being of students and faculty;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(ii): maintain order and discipline on school premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(iii): prevent a material and substantial interference with the orderly conduct of a school's educational activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(iv): protect the rights of parents and students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(v): maintain the boundaries of socially appropriate behavior; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(a)(vi): ensure compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and policies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(b): if a club's proposed charter and proposed activities indicate students or advisors in club related activities would as a substantial, material, or significant part of their conduct or means of expression:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(b)(i): encourage criminal or delinquent conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(b)(ii): promote bigotry;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(b)(iii): involve human sexuality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(1)(b)(iv): involve any effort to engage in or conduct mental health therapy, counseling, or psychological services for which a license would be required under state law.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(2): (1) An LEA governing board has the authority to determine whether any club meets the criteria of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(3): If a school or LEA governing board limits or denies authorization to a club, the school or LEA governing board shall provide, in writing, to the applicant the factual and legal basis for the limitation or denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-705(4): 53E-9-203(1) A student's spontaneous expression of sentiments or opinions otherwise identified in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706 Faculty oversight of authorized clubs.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(1): A school shall approve the faculty sponsor, supervisor, or monitor for each authorized curricular, noncurricular, and religious club to provide oversight consistent with this part and the needs of the school to ensure that the methods of expression, religious practices, or other conduct of the students or advisors involved do not:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(1)(a): unreasonably interfere with the ability of school officials to maintain order and discipline;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(1)(b): unreasonably endanger or threaten the well-being of persons or property;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(1)(c): violate concepts of civility or propriety appropriate to a school setting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(1)(d): violate applicable laws, rules, regulations, and policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(2)(a): A school shall annually approve faculty members as sponsors of curricular clubs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(2)(b): Faculty sponsors shall organize and direct the purpose and activities of a curricular club.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(3)(a): A school shall approve faculty members to serve as supervisors for authorized noncurricular clubs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(3)(b): A faculty supervisor shall provide oversight to ensure compliance with the approved club purposes, goals, and activities and with the provisions of this part and other applicable laws, rules, and policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(3)(c): The approval of a faculty supervisor or monitor does not constitute school sponsorship of the club.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(3)(d): A faculty monitor approved for a religious club may not participate in the activities of the religious club, except to perform the supervisory role required by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(4): Without the prior approval by the school, a person who is not a school faculty member or a club member may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(4)(a): make a presentation to a noncurricular club; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-706(4)(b): direct, conduct, control, or regularly attend the meetings of a noncurricular club.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707 Use of school facilities by clubs.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(1): A school shall determine and assign school facilities use for curricular and noncurricular clubs consistent with the needs of the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(2): The following provisions apply to curricular clubs:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(2)(a): in assigning school facilities use, the administrator may give priority to curricular clubs over noncurricular clubs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(2)(b): the school may provide financial or other support to curricular clubs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3): The following provisions apply to noncurricular clubs:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(a): a preference or priority may not be given among noncurricular clubs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(b)(i): a school shall only provide the space for noncurricular club meetings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(b)(ii): a school may not spend public funds for noncurricular clubs, except as required to implement the provisions of this part, including providing space and faculty oversight for noncurricular clubs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(c): a school shall establish the noninstructional times during which noncurricular clubs may meet;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(d): a school may establish the places that noncurricular clubs may meet;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(e): a school may set the number of hours noncurricular clubs may use the school's facilities per month, provided that all noncurricular clubs shall be treated equally; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-707(3)(f): a school shall determine what access noncurricular clubs shall be given to the school newspaper, yearbook, bulletin boards, or public address system, provided that all noncurricular clubs shall be treated equally.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708 Club membership.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(1): A school shall require written parental consent for student participation in all curricular and noncurricular clubs at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2): 53G-7-709 Membership in curricular clubs is governed by the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(a): 53G-7-709
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(a)(i): membership may be limited to students who are currently attending the sponsoring school or school district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(a)(ii): 53G-7-709 members who attend a school other than the sponsoring school shall have, in addition to the consent required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(b)(i): curricular clubs may require that prospective members try out based on objective criteria outlined in the application materials; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(b)(ii): try-outs may not require activities that violate the provisions of this part and other applicable laws, rules, and policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(2)(c): other rules or policies as determined by the state board, school district, or school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3): Membership in noncurricular clubs is governed by the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(a): student membership in a noncurricular club is voluntary;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(b): membership shall be limited to students who are currently attending the school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(c)(i): noncurricular clubs may require that prospective members try out based on objective criteria outlined in the application materials; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(c)(ii): try-outs may not require activities that violate the provisions of this part and other applicable laws, rules, and policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(d): a copy of any written or other media materials that were presented at a noncurricular club meeting by a nonschool person shall be delivered to a school administrator no later than 24 hours after the noncurricular club meeting and, if requested, a student's parent shall have an opportunity to review those materials; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-708(3)(e): other rules or policies as determined by the state board, school district, or school.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709 Parental consent.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(1): A school shall require written parental consent for student participation in all curricular and noncurricular clubs at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2): (1); 53G-7-703; 53G-7-704 The consent described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2)(b): a statement of the club's purpose, goals, and activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2)(c): 53G-7-703; 53G-7-704 a statement of the club's categorization, which shall be obtained from the application for authorization of a club in accordance with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2)(c)(i): athletic;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2)(c)(ii): business/economic;

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(2)(c)(vii): religious;

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-709(3): All completed parental consent forms shall be filed by the parent or the club's sponsor, supervisor, or monitor with the school's principal, the chief administrative officer of a charter school, or their designee.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710 Violations -- Investigations -- School responses.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(1): A school shall investigate any report or allegation that an authorized curricular or noncurricular club is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(1)(a): participating in activities beyond the scope of its purpose; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(1)(b): in violation of a provision of this part or another applicable law, rule, regulation, or policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(2): After meeting with the faculty sponsor, faculty supervisor, or faculty monitor, the students involved, and the person making the report or allegation, if a violation is substantiated, the school may do any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(2)(a): allow the club's original statement of its purpose, goals, and activities to be modified to include the activities if they are in compliance with the provisions of this part and other applicable laws, rules, regulations, or policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(2)(b): instruct the faculty sponsor, supervisor, or monitor not to allow similar violations in the future;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(2)(c): limit or suspend the club's authorization or school facilities use pending further corrective action as determined by the school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(2)(d): terminate the club's authorization and dissolve the club.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(3): Any limitation on expression, practice, or conduct of any student, advisor, or guest in a meeting of a curricular or noncurricular club, or limitation on school facilities use, shall be by the least restrictive means necessary to satisfy the school's interests as identified in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(4): (2)(d) A club that has been terminated in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-710(5): A student who makes a false allegation or report under this section shall be subject to school discipline.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711 Appeals -- Procedures.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(1)(a): A completed application or complaint shall be approved, denied, or investigated by the school within a reasonable amount of time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(1)(b): If an application or complaint is denied, written reasons for the denial or results of the investigation shall be stated and, if appropriate, suggested corrections shall be made to remedy the deficiency.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(1)(c): A club that is denied school facilities use shall be informed at the time of the denial of the factual and legal basis for the denial, and, if appropriate, how the basis for the denial could be corrected.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(2)(a): If denied, suspended, or terminated, a club, student desirous of participating or speaking, or a complaining parent, has 10 school days from the date of the denial, suspension, or termination to file a written appeal from the denial, suspension, or termination to a designee authorized by the LEA governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(2)(b): The designee shall issue a determination within a reasonable amount of time from receipt of the appeal, which decision is final and constitutes satisfaction of all administrative remedies unless the time for evaluation is extended by agreement of all parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-711(3): A person directly affected by a decision made in accordance with the provisions of this part may appeal the decision by writing to a person designated by the LEA governing board.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-712 Rulemaking -- State board -- LEA governing boards.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The state board may adopt additional rules and LEA governing boards may adopt additional policies governing clubs that do not conflict with the provisions of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-713 Severability.
---------------------------------------------
If any provision of this part or the application of any provision to any person or circumstance, is held invalid, the remainder of this part shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(1): "Association" means an organization that governs or regulates a student's participation in an athletic activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(2): "Athletic activity" means physical education instruction or a sports event that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(2)(a): sponsored or regulated by an association or educational organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(2)(b): authorized to take place in an association's or educational organization's facilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(3): "Athletic uniform" means clothing, headwear, shoes, or other items worn for participation in an athletic activity that are required to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(3)(a): a specified style, length, material, or color;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(3)(b): worn in a specified manner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(3)(c): worn with or without other items of clothing or headwear.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(4): "Educational organization" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(4)(a): the state board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(4)(b): an LEA; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(4)(c): a school sports team.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(5): "Principal" includes the chief administrator of a school that does not have a principal.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(6): "School" means a public school, including a charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(7): "School official" means the principal of a school or the local school board for a school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(8): "School sports team" means a team on which the student represents the student's school in competition against another school or in competition against other students within the same school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-801(9): 53G-7-501 "School uniform" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802 Uniforms in schools -- Legislative finding -- Policies.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1): The Legislature finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(a): each student should be allowed to learn in a safe environment which fosters the learning process and is free from unnecessary disruptions;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(b): the wearing of certain types of clothing may identify students as members of youth gangs and contribute to disruptive behavior and violence in the schools;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(c): school uniform policies may be part of an overall program to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(c)(i): improve school safety and discipline; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(c)(ii): help avoid the disruption of the classroom atmosphere and decorum and prevent disturbances among students; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(d): school uniforms may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(d)(i): decrease violence and theft among students; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(1)(d)(ii): foster and promote desirable school operating conditions and a positive educational environment in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(2): 53G-7-803; (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(2)(a): 53G-7-803 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(2)(b): (4)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3): (5) A school uniform policy shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(a): protect students' free exercise of religious beliefs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(b): specify whether the uniform policy is voluntary or mandatory for students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(c): (5) specify whether or not the uniform policy has an opt-out provision in addition to the provisions under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(d): include a provision for financial assistance to families who cannot afford to purchase a required uniform, which may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(d)(i): the school providing school uniforms to students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(d)(ii): the school making used school uniforms available to students; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(3)(d)(iii): other programs to make school uniforms available to economically disadvantaged students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(4): (4)(b); (4)(b)(ii); (4)(b)(i); 53G-7-501; Part 5, Student Fees
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(4)(a): (4)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(4)(b): (4)(b)(ii); (4)(b)(i); 53G-7-501; Part 5, Student Fees
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(4)(b)(i): (4)(b)(ii) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i); 53G-7-501; Part 5, Student Fees A school uniform policy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(5): A school uniform policy shall include a provision allowing a principal at any time during the school year to grant an exemption from wearing a school uniform to a student because of extenuating circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(6): (5); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(6)(a): (5) If a school adopts a school uniform policy under this part, that school's governing body or local school board shall adopt local appellate procedures for school actions under this part, including a denial of an exemption requested under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-802(6)(b): (6) A person may seek judicial review of an action under this part only after exhausting the remedies provided under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804 Requirements for uniforms for students participating in an athletic activity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(1): An association or educational organization that requires a student to wear an athletic uniform for participation in an athletic activity may not prohibit the student from:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(1)(a): wearing religious clothing with the athletic uniform; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(1)(b): wearing clothing under, or with, but not substantially covering, the athletic uniform to, consistent with the student's religious or moral beliefs, cover or conceal parts of the student's body that are not covered or concealed by the athletic uniform.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(2)(b): (1); (2)(a) The prohibition described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(3): (1); (2) If an association or educational organization places requirements on religious clothing or other clothing described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(3)(a): shall provide the clothing at the association's or educational organization's expense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-804(3)(b): may not impose a requirement in relation to the clothing, including the material, color, style, or manner of wearing the clothing, that violates the student's religious or moral beliefs.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(1): "Cooperating employer" means a public or private entity which, as part of a work experience or career exploration program offered through a school, provides interns with educational resources, training, and work experience in activities related to the entity's ongoing business activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(2): 53G-7-902 "Intern" means a student enrolled in a school-sponsored work experience and career exploration program under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(3): "Internship" means the work experience segment of an intern's school-sponsored work experience and career exploration program, performed under the direct supervision of a cooperating employer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(4): 53G-7-904 "Internship safety agreement" means the agreement between a public or private school and a cooperating employer in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(5): "Private school" means a school serving any of grades 7 through 12 which is not part of the public education system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(6): "Public school" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(6)(a): a public school district;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(6)(b): an applied technology center or applied technology service region;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(6)(c): the Schools for the Deaf and the Blind; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-901(6)(d): other components of the public education system authorized by the state board to offer internships.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-902 Public or private school internships.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
A public or private school may offer internships in connection with work experience and career exploration programs operated in accordance with the rules of the state board.
