Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-905 Recognition of participation in internship program.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A cooperating employer may be given appropriate recognition by a school, including the posting of the employer's name and a short description of the employer's business in an appropriate location on school property, or publication of that information in official publications of the school or school district.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1001 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1002 Internet and online access policy required.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
State funds may not be provided to any local school board that provides access to the Internet or an online service unless the local school board adopts and enforces a policy to restrict access to Internet or online sites that contain obscene material.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003 Process and content standards for policy.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(1): 53G-7-1002 "Policy" as used in this section means the elementary and secondary school online access policy adopted by a local school board to meet the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(2)(a): Each policy shall be developed under the direction of the local school board, adopted in an open meeting, and have an effective date.  The local school board shall review the policy at least every three years, and a footnote shall be added to the policy indicating the effective date of the last review.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(2)(b): Notice of the availability of the policy shall be posted in a conspicuous place within each school.  The local school board may issue any other public notice it considers appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(3): 53G-7-1002 The policy shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(3)(a): 53G-7-1002 state that it restricts access to Internet or online sites that contain obscene material and shall state how the local school board intends to meet the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(3)(b): inform the public that administrative procedures and guidelines for the staff to follow in enforcing the policy have been adopted and are available for review at the school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1003(3)(c): inform the public that procedures to handle complaints about the policy, its enforcement, or about observed behavior have been adopted and are available for review at the school.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(1): "Alignment" or "realignment" means the initial or subsequent act, respectively, of assigning a public school a classification or region.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(2): 53G-7-1106 "Appeals panel" means the appeals panel created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(3): 53B-1-102
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(3)(a): "Association" means an organization that governs or regulates a student's participation in an athletic interscholastic activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(3)(b): 53B-1-102 "Association" does not include an institution of higher education described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(4): "Classification" means the designation of a school based on the size of the school's student enrollment population for purposes of interscholastic activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(5): "Eligibility" means eligibility to participate in an interscholastic activity regulated or governed by an association.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6): "Governing body" means a body within an association that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(a): is responsible for:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(a)(i): adopting standards or policies that govern interscholastic activities or the administration of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(a)(ii): adopting or amending the association's governing document or bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(a)(iii): enforcing the standards and policies of the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(a)(iv): adopting the association's budget; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(6)(b): has oversight of other boards, committees, councils, or bodies within the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(7): "Interscholastic activity" means an activity within the state in which:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(7)(a): a student that participates represents the student's school in the activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(7)(b): the participating student is enrolled in grade 9, 10, 11, or 12.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(8): "Public hearing" means a hearing at which members of the public are provided a reasonable opportunity to comment on the subject of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1101(9): "Region" means a grouping of schools of the same classification for purposes of interscholastic activities.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105 Association budgets.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(1): An association shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(1)(a): adopt a budget in accordance with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(1)(b): use uniform budgeting, accounting, and auditing procedures and forms, which shall be in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles or auditing standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(2): An association budget officer or executive director shall annually prepare a tentative budget, with supporting documentation, to be submitted to the governing body.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(3): The tentative budget and supporting documents shall include the following items:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(3)(a): the revenues and expenditures of the preceding fiscal year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(3)(b): the estimated revenues and expenditures of the current fiscal year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(3)(c): a detailed estimate of the essential expenditures for all purposes for the next succeeding fiscal year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(3)(d): the estimated financial condition of the association by funds at the close of the current fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(4): The tentative budget shall be filed with the governing body 15 days, or earlier, before the date of the tentative budget's proposed adoption by the governing body.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(5): The governing body shall adopt a budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(6): Before the adoption or amendment of a budget, the governing body shall hold a public hearing on the proposed budget or budget amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(7): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act; (6); 63A-16-601; (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(7)(a): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act; (6); 63A-16-601 In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(7)(a)(i): 63A-16-601 publish a notice of the public hearing electronically in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(7)(a)(ii): post the proposed budget on the association's Internet website.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(7)(b): (7)(a) A notice of a public hearing on an association's proposed budget shall include information on how the public may access the proposed budget as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1105(8): No later than September 30 of each year, the governing body shall file a copy of the adopted budget with the state auditor and the state board.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202 School community councils -- Duties -- Composition -- Election procedures and selection of members.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1): 53E-6-102; 53F-2-404 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(a): "Digital citizenship" means the norms of appropriate, responsible, and healthy behavior related to technology use, including digital literacy, ethics, etiquette, and security.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(b): 53E-6-102 "Educator" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(c)(i): "Parent member" means a member of a school community council who is a parent of a student who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(c)(i)(A): is attending the school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(c)(i)(B): will be enrolled at the school during the parent's term of office.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(c)(ii): "Parent member" may not include an educator who is employed at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(d): "Safety principles" means safety principles that, when incorporated into programs and resources, impact academic achievement by strengthening a safe and wholesome learning environment, including continual efforts for safe technology utilization and digital citizenship.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(e): "School community council" means a council established at a district school in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(f): "School employee member" means a member of a school community council who is a person employed at the school by the school or school district, including the principal.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(1)(g): 53F-2-404 "School LAND Trust Program money" means money allocated to a school pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2): A district school, in consultation with the district school's local school board, shall establish a school community council at the school building level for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(a): involving parents of students in decision making at the school level;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(b): improving the education of students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(c): prudently expending School LAND Trust Program money for the improvement of students' education through collaboration among parents, school employees, and the local school board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(d): increasing public awareness of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(d)(i): school trust lands and related land policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(d)(ii): management of the State School Fund established in Utah Constitution Article X, Section V; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(2)(d)(iii): educational excellence.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3): 53G-7-1206; 53G-4-402; 53G-7-216; 53G-10-407
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a): 53G-7-1206; 53G-4-402; 53G-7-216; 53G-10-407 Except as provided in Subsection (3)(b), a school community council shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(i): 53G-7-1206 create the School LAND Trust Program and LAND Trust plan in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii): 53G-4-402 advise and make recommendations to school and school district administrators and the local school board regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii)(A): the school and its programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii)(B): school district programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii)(C): 53G-4-402 a child access routing plan in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii)(D): safe technology utilization and digital citizenship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(ii)(E): other issues relating to the community environment for students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(iii): provide for education and awareness on safe technology utilization and digital citizenship that empowers:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(iii)(B): a parent to know how to discuss safe technology use with the parent's child;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(iv): 53G-7-216 partner with the school's principal and other administrators to ensure that adequate on and off campus Internet filtering is installed and consistently configured to prevent viewing of harmful content by students and school personnel, in accordance with local school board policy and Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(v): in accordance with state board rule regarding school community council expenditures and funding limits:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(v)(A): work with students, families, and educators to develop and incorporate safety principles at the school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(v)(B): hold at least an annual discussion with the school's principal and district administrators regarding safety principles at the school and district level in order to coordinate the school community council's effort to develop and incorporate safety principles at the school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(a)(vi): 53G-10-407 provide input to the school's principal on a positive behaviors plan in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(b): To fulfill the school community council's duties described in Subsections (3)(a)(iii) and (iv), a school community council may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(b)(i): partner with one or more non-profit organizations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(b)(ii): create a subcommittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(3)(c): A school or school district administrator may not prohibit or discourage a school community council from discussing issues, or offering advice or recommendations, regarding the school and its programs, school district programs, the curriculum, or the community environment for students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(e), each school community council shall consist of school employee members and parent members in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(b): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(c) or (d):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(b)(i): each school community council for a high school shall have six parent members and four school employee members, including the principal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(b)(ii): each school community council for a school other than a high school shall have four parent members and two school employee members, including the principal.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(c): A school community council may determine the size of the school community council by a majority vote of a quorum of the school community council provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(c)(i): the membership includes two or more parent members than the number of school employee members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(c)(ii): there are at least two school employee members on the school community council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(d)(i): The number of parent members of a school community council who are not educators employed by the school district shall exceed the number of parent members who are educators employed by the school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(d)(ii): If, after an election, the number of parent members who are not educators employed by the school district does not exceed the number of parent members who are educators employed by the school district, the parent members of the school community council shall appoint one or more parent members to the school community council so that the number of parent members who are not educators employed by the school district exceeds the number of parent members who are educators employed by the school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(4)(e): The state board may make rules, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, governing a school community council when, under unique circumstances that the state board identifies, there are insufficient members to fill the positions described in this Subsection (4).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5): 53G-7-1203
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(f), a school employee member, other than the principal, shall be elected by secret ballot by a majority vote of the school employees and serve a two-year term.  The principal shall serve as an ex officio member with full voting privileges.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(f), a parent member shall be elected by secret ballot at an election held at the school by a majority vote of those voting at the election and serve a two-year term.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(ii)(A): Except as provided in Subsection (5)(b)(ii)(B), only a parent of a student attending the school may vote in, or run as a candidate in, the election under Subsection (5)(b)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(ii)(B): If an election is held in the spring, a parent of a student who will be attending the school the following school year may vote in, and run as a candidate in, the election under Subsection (5)(b)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(iii): Any parent of a student who meets the qualifications of this section may file or declare the parent's candidacy for election to a school community council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(iv): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(iv)(A): Subject to Subsections (5)(b)(iv)(B) and (5)(b)(iv)(C), a timeline for the election of parent members of a school community council shall be established by a local school board for the schools within the school district.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(iv)(B): An election for the parent members of a school community council shall be held near the beginning of the school year or held in the spring and completed before the last week of school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(b)(iv)(C): Each school shall establish a time period for the election of parent members of a school community council under Subsection (5)(b)(iv)(B) that is consistent for at least a four-year period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(i): At least 10 days before the date that voting commences for the elections held under Subsections (5)(a) and (5)(b), the principal of the school, or the principal's designee, shall provide notice to each school employee or parent of the opportunity to vote in, and run as a candidate in, an election under this Subsection (5).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(ii): The notice shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(ii)(A): the dates and times of the elections;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(ii)(B): a list of council positions that are up for election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(ii)(C): instructions for becoming a candidate for a community council position.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(iii): The principal of the school, or the principal's designee, shall oversee the elections held under Subsections (5)(a) and (5)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(c)(iv): Ballots cast in an election held under Subsection (5)(b) shall be deposited in a secure ballot box.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(d): Results of the elections held under Subsections (5)(a) and (5)(b) shall be made available to the public upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(e)(i): If a parent position on a school community council remains unfilled after an election is held, the other parent members of the council shall appoint a parent who meets the qualifications of this section to fill the position.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(e)(ii): If a school employee position on a school community council remains unfilled after an election is held, the other school employee members of the council shall appoint a school employee to fill the position.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(e)(iii): A member appointed to a school community council under Subsection (5)(e)(i) or (ii) shall serve a two-year term.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(f)(i): If the number of candidates who file for a parent position or school employee position on a school community council is less than or equal to the number of open positions, an election is not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(f)(ii): If an election is not held pursuant to Subsection (5)(f)(i) and a parent position remains unfilled, the other parent members of the council shall appoint a parent who meets the qualifications of this section to fill the position.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(f)(iii): If an election is not held pursuant to Subsection (5)(f)(i) and a school employee position remains unfilled, the other school employee members of the council shall appoint a school employee who meets the qualifications of this section to fill the position.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(g): 53G-7-1203 The principal shall enter the names of the council members on the School LAND Trust website on or before October 20 of each year, pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(h): Terms shall be staggered so that approximately half of the council members stand for election each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(i): A school community council member may serve successive terms provided the member continues to meet the definition of a parent member or school employee member as specified in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(j): Each school community council shall elect:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(j)(i): a chair from its parent members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(5)(j)(ii): a vice chair from either its parent members or school employee members, excluding the principal.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6)(a): A school community council may create subcommittees or task forces to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6)(a)(i): advise or make recommendations to the council; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6)(a)(ii): develop all or part of a plan listed in Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6)(b): Any plan or part of a plan developed by a subcommittee or task force shall be subject to the approval of the school community council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(6)(c): A school community council may appoint individuals who are not council members to serve on a subcommittee or task force, including parents, school employees, or other community members.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(7)(a): A majority of the members of a school community council is a quorum for the transaction of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(7)(b): The action of a majority of the members of a quorum is the action of the school community council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(8): A local school board shall provide training for a school community council each year, including training:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(8)(a): for the chair and vice chair about their responsibilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(8)(b): on resources available on the School LAND Trust website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1202(8)(c): on this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206 School LAND Trust Program.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1): 53G-7-1205; 53G-7-1202; 53G-7-1301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1)(a): 53G-7-1205 "Charter trust land council" means a council established by a charter school governing board under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1)(b): "Council" means a school community council or a charter trust land council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1)(c): "LAND trust plan" means a school's plan to use School LAND Trust Program money to implement a component of the school's success plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1)(d): 53G-7-1202 "School community council" means a council established at a district school in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(1)(e): 53G-7-1301 "Teacher and student success plan" or "success plan" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(2): This section creates the School LAND (Learning And Nurturing Development) Trust Program under the state board to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(2)(a): provide financial resources to public schools to enhance or improve student academic achievement and implement a component of a district school or charter school's teacher and student success plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(2)(b): involve parents of a school's students in decision making regarding the expenditure of School LAND Trust Program money allocated to the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(3): 53F-2-404; 53G-7-1202; 53G-7-1205 To receive an allocation under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(3)(a): 53G-7-1202 a district school shall have established a school community council in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(3)(b): 53G-7-1205 a charter school shall have established a charter trust land council in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(3)(c): the school's principal shall provide a signed, written assurance that the school is in compliance with Subsection (3)(a) or (b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4): 53F-2-404
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(a): 53F-2-404 A council shall create a program to use the school's allocation distributed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(a)(i): the school's identified most critical academic needs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(a)(ii): a recommended course of action to meet the identified academic needs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(a)(iii): a specific listing of any programs, practices, materials, or equipment that the school will need to implement a component of the school's success plan to have a direct impact on the instruction of students and result in measurable increased student performance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(a)(iv): how the school intends to spend the school's allocation of funds under this section to enhance or improve academic excellence at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(b)(i): A council shall create and vote to adopt a LAND trust plan in a meeting of the council at which a quorum is present.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(b)(ii): If a majority of the quorum votes to adopt a LAND trust plan, the LAND trust plan is adopted.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(c): A council shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(c)(i): post a LAND trust plan that is adopted in accordance with Subsection (4)(b) on the School LAND Trust Program website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(c)(ii): include with the LAND trust plan a report noting the number of council members who voted for or against the approval of the LAND trust plan and the number of council members who were absent for the vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d)(i): The local school board of a district school shall approve or disapprove a LAND trust plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d)(ii): If a local school board disapproves a LAND trust plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d)(ii)(A): the local school board shall provide a written explanation of why the LAND trust plan was disapproved and request the school community council who submitted the LAND trust plan to revise the LAND trust plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d)(ii)(B): the school community council shall submit a revised LAND trust plan in response to a local school board's request under Subsection (4)(d)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(d)(iii): Once a LAND trust plan has been approved by a local school board, a school community council may amend the LAND trust plan, subject to a majority vote of the school community council and local school board approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(e): A charter trust land council's LAND trust plan is subject to approval by the:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(e)(i): charter school governing board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(4)(e)(ii): budget officer whom the charter school governing board appoints.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(a): A district school or charter school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(a)(i): implement the program as approved;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(a)(ii): provide ongoing support for the council's program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(a)(iii): meet state board reporting requirements regarding financial and performance accountability of the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(b)(i): A district school or charter school shall prepare and post an annual report of the program on the School LAND Trust Program website before the council submits a plan for the following year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(b)(ii): The report shall detail the use of program funds received by the school under this section and an assessment of the results obtained from the use of the funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(5)(b)(iii): A summary of the report shall be provided to parents of students who attend the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(6): An LEA shall record the LEA's expenditures of School LAND Trust Program funds through a financial reporting system that the board identifies to assist schools in developing the annual report described in Subsection (5)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(7): The president or chair of a local school board or charter school governing board shall ensure that the members of the local school board or charter school governing board are provided with annual training on the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(a): The state board shall provide training to the entities described in Subsection (8)(b) on:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(a)(i): the School LAND Trust Program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(a)(ii)(A): a school community council; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(a)(ii)(B): a charter trust land council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(b): The state board shall provide the training to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(b)(i): a local school board or a charter school governing board;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(b)(ii): a school district or a charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(8)(b)(iii): a school community council.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(9): The state board shall annually review each school's compliance with applicable law, including rules adopted by the state board in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(9)(a): reading each LAND trust plan submitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(9)(b): reviewing expenditures made from School LAND Trust Program money.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(10): 53D-2-202; 53D-2-203; 53D-2-102 The state board shall designate a staff member who administers the School LAND Trust Program:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(10)(a): 53D-2-202 to serve as a member of the Land Trusts Protection and Advocacy Committee created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1206(10)(b): 53D-2-203; 53D-2-102 who may coordinate with the Land Trusts Protection and Advocacy Office director, appointed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(1): 53G-7-1303 "LEA distribution" means the money distributed by the state board to an LEA as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(2): 53G-7-1304 "LEA governing board student success framework" means an LEA governing board student success framework described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(3): "Principal" means the chief administrator at a school, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(3)(a): a school principal;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(3)(b): a charter school director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(3)(c): the superintendent of the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(4): 53G-7-1304 "School allocation" means the amount of money allocated to a school or the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind by an LEA governing board, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(5): "School personnel" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(5)(a): is employed by an LEA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(5)(b): in an academic role, works directly with and supports students in a school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(6): "Statewide accountability system" means the statewide school accountability system described in Title 53E, Chapter 5, Part 2, School Accountability System.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(7): 53G-7-1307 "Teaching Self-Government Skills for Success, Classroom Communication, and Discipline Framework Pilot Program" or "pilot program" means the pilot program created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(8): 53G-7-1305 "Teacher and student success plan" or "success plan" means a school performance and student academic achievement improvement plan described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1301(9): "Teacher and Student Success Program" or "program" means the Teacher and Student Success Program described in this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1302 Teacher and Student Success Program created.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
There is created the Teacher and Student Success Program to improve school performance and student academic achievement, as described in this part.

The state board shall distribute program funding to an LEA as described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1304(1): 53G-7-1307
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1304(1)(a): To receive an LEA distribution, an LEA governing board shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307 Teaching Self-Government Skills for Success, Classroom Communication, and Discipline Framework Pilot Program.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1): Beginning May 1, 2025, there is created within the Teacher and Student Success Program, a three-year pilot program known as the Teaching Self-Government Skills for Success, Classroom Communication, and Discipline Framework Pilot Program to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1)(a): train school faculty and students in personal self-government communication and problem solving practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1)(b): improve:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1)(b)(i): classroom discipline;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1)(b)(ii): teacher and student mental health; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(1)(b)(iii): classroom management.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(2): The state board shall create a training course that an LEA or school shall use if the LEA or school chooses to participate in the pilot program.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(a): The state board shall ensure the training course described in Subsection (2) contains the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(a)(i): effective classroom management;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(a)(ii): appropriate approaches to student behavior and discipline consistent with federal and state law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(a)(iii): effective tools to de-escalate behavior.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b): The state board shall ensure the training described in Subsection (3)(a) is consistent with the following principles:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(i): personal self-government;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(ii): accepting consequences;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(iii): respecting boundaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(iv): accepting criticism;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(v): disagreeing appropriately; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(3)(b)(vi): following instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(4): An LEA with a participating school:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(4)(a): shall ensure that each teacher in the participating school annually receives the materials of the course described in Subsection (3); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(4)(b): may not provide the training course outside of the LEA or the participating school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the board shall make rules establishing:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a): how an LEA provides to a teacher at a participating school the following stipends upon completion of different modules consistent with Subsection (3):
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(i): $100 for completion and implementation of one module;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(ii): $300 for completion and implementation of two modules;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(iii): $300 for completion and implementation of three modules; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(iv): $1,000 for completion of an action plan project that requires a teacher to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(iv)(A): create a school or classroom plan that follows the pilot program's training course; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(a)(iv)(B): submit research, evidence, and a reflection paper regarding the results of the project; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(b): a reporting requirement for a participating LEA including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(b)(i): metrics of success for the pilot program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(5)(b)(ii): other information the state board determines.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(6): The state board may designate at least one staff position to provide oversight and technical support for the pilot program and the pilot program's implementation.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-7-1307(7): Upon request of the Education Interim Committee, an LEA with schools implementing the pilot program shall report to the Education Interim Committee on the pilot program's progress and outcomes.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202 Public school discipline policies -- Basis of the policies -- Enforcement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(1): The Legislature recognizes that every student in the public schools should have the opportunity to learn in an environment which is safe, conducive to the learning process, and free from unnecessary disruption.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2): 53G-8-211; 53B-17-1202(3)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(a): 53G-8-211 To foster such an environment, each local school board or charter school governing board, with input from school employees, parents of students, students, and the community at large, shall adopt conduct and discipline policies for the public schools in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(b): A district or charter school shall base its policies on the principle that every student is expected:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(b)(i): to follow accepted standards of conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(b)(ii): to show respect for other people and to obey persons in authority at the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(c): 53B-17-1202(3)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(c)(i): 53B-17-1202(3) On or before September 1, 2015, the state board shall revise the conduct and discipline policy models for elementary and secondary public schools to include procedures for responding to reports received through the SafeUT Crisis Line under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(c)(ii): Each district or charter school shall use the models, where appropriate, in developing its conduct and discipline policies under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(2)(d): The policies shall emphasize that certain behavior, most particularly behavior which disrupts, is unacceptable and may result in disciplinary action.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-202(3): The local superintendent and designated employees of the district or charter school shall enforce the policies so that students demonstrating unacceptable behavior and their parents understand that such behavior will not be tolerated and will be dealt with in accordance with the district's conduct and discipline policies.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4):

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(iii): if a student has committed a serious offense or sexual crime, provide a process for a school resource officer to provide input for the LEA to consider regarding the safety risks a student may pose upon reintegration;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(iv): establish a process to inform a school resource officer of any student who is on probation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(v): create procedures for determining an alternative placement for a student if the student attends the same school as:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(v)(A): the victim of the student's crime; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(v)(B): an individual who has a protective order against the student; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-203(4)(b)(vi): be compliant with state and federal law.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204 Suspension and expulsion procedures -- Notice to parents -- Distribution of policies.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1)(a): Policies required under this part shall include written procedures for the suspension and expulsion of, or denial of admission to, a student, consistent with due process and other provisions of law.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1)(b)(i): The policies required in Subsection (1)(a) shall include a procedure directing public schools to notify the custodial parent and, if requested in writing by a noncustodial parent, the noncustodial parent of the suspension and expulsion of, or denial of admission to, a student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1)(b)(ii): Subsection (1)(b)(i) does not apply to that portion of school records which would disclose any information protected under a court order.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(1)(b)(iii): The custodial parent is responsible for providing to the school a certified copy of the court order under Subsection (1)(b)(ii) through a procedure adopted by the local governing board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(2)(a): Each local governing board shall provide for the distribution of a copy of a school's discipline and conduct policy to each student upon enrollment in the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(2)(b): A copy of the policy shall be posted in a prominent location in each school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-204(2)(c): Any significant change in a school's conduct and discipline policy shall be distributed to students in the school and posted in the school in a prominent location.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205 Grounds for suspension or expulsion from a public school.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1): 32B-1-102 A student may be suspended or expelled from a public school for the following reasons:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(a): frequent or flagrant willful disobedience, defiance of proper authority, or disruptive behavior, including the use of foul, profane, vulgar, or abusive language;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(b): willful destruction or defacing of school property;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(c): behavior or threatened behavior which poses an immediate and significant threat to the welfare, safety, or morals of other students or school personnel or to the operation of the school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(d): 32B-1-102 possession, control, or use of an alcoholic beverage as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(e): behavior proscribed under Subsection (2) which threatens harm or does harm to the school or school property, to a person associated with the school, or property associated with that person, regardless of where it occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(1)(f): possession or use of pornographic material on school property.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2): 58-37-2; 58-37b-2; 58-37a-3; 76-9-202(2)(d); 53G-8-203; 53G-8-208
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a): 58-37-2; 58-37b-2; 58-37a-3; 76-9-202(2)(d) A student shall be suspended or expelled from a public school for the following reasons:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(i): 58-37-2; 58-37b-2; 58-37a-3 a serious violation affecting another student or a staff member, or a serious violation occurring in a school building, in or on school property, or in conjunction with a school activity, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(i)(A): the possession, control, or actual or threatened use of a real weapon, explosive, or noxious or flammable material;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(i)(B): the actual use of violence or sexual misconduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(i)(C): the actual or threatened use of a look alike weapon with intent to intimidate another person or to disrupt normal school activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(i)(D): 58-37-2; 58-37b-2; 58-37a-3 the sale, control, or distribution of a drug or controlled substance as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(ii): the commission of an act involving the use of force or the threatened use of force which if committed by an adult would be a felony or class A misdemeanor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(a)(iii): 76-9-202(2)(d) making a false report of an emergency at a school under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b): 53G-8-203; 53G-8-208 A student who commits a violation of Subsection (2)(a) involving a real or look alike weapon, explosive, or flammable material shall be expelled from school for a period of not less than one year subject to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b)(i): within 45 days after the expulsion the student shall appear before the student's superintendent, the superintendent's designee, chief administrative officer of a charter school, or the chief administrative officer's designee, accompanied by a parent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b)(ii): 53G-8-203; 53G-8-208 the superintendent, chief administrator, or designee shall determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b)(ii)(A): 53G-8-203 what conditions must be met by the student and the student's parent for the student to return to school, including any provided for in the policies described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b)(ii)(B): 53G-8-208 if the student should be placed on probation in a regular or alternative school setting consistent with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(2)(b)(ii)(C): if it would be in the best interest of both the LEA, and the student, to modify the expulsion term to less than a year, conditioned on approval by the local governing board and giving highest priority to providing a safe school environment for all students.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(3): A student may be denied admission to a public school on the basis of having been expelled from that or any other school during the preceding 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(4): 53G-6-204 A suspension or expulsion under this section is not subject to the age limitations under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(5): A local governing board shall prepare an annual report for the state board on:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(5)(a): each violation committed under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-205(5)(b): each action taken by the LEA against a student who committed the violation.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206 Delegation of authority to suspend or expel a student -- Procedure for suspension -- Readmission.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(1)(a): A local school board may delegate to any school principal or assistant principal within the school district the power to suspend a student in the principal's school for up to 10 school days.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(1)(b): A charter school governing board may delegate to the chief administrative officer of the charter school the power to suspend a student in the charter school for up to 10 school days.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(2): The local school board or charter school governing board may suspend a student for up to one school year or delegate that power to  the district superintendent, the superintendent's designee, or chief administrative officer of a charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(3): The local school board may expel a student for a fixed or indefinite period, provided that the expulsion shall be reviewed by the district superintendent or the superintendent's designee and the conclusions reported to the local school board, at least once each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(4): If a student is suspended, a designated school official shall notify the parent of the student of the following without delay:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(4)(a): that the student has been suspended;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(4)(b): the grounds for the suspension;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(4)(c): the period of time for which the student is suspended; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(4)(d): the time and place for the parent to meet with a designated school official to review the suspension.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5): (5)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5)(a): A suspended student shall immediately leave the school building and the school grounds following a determination by the school of the best way to transfer custody of the student to the parent or other person authorized by the parent or applicable law to accept custody of the student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5)(b): (5)(c) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5)(b)(i): the student and the parent have met with a designated school official to review the suspension and agreed upon a plan to avoid recurrence of the problem; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5)(b)(ii): in the discretion of the principal or chief administrative officer of a charter school, the parent of the suspended student and the student have agreed to participate in such a meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-206(5)(c): A suspension may not extend beyond 10 school days unless the student and the student's parent have been given a reasonable opportunity to meet with a designated school official and respond to the allegations and proposed disciplinary action.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207 Alternatives to suspension or expulsion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(1): Each local school board or charter school governing board shall establish:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(1)(a): policies providing that prior to suspending or expelling a student for repeated acts of willful disobedience, defiance of authority, or disruptive behavior which are not of such a violent or extreme nature that immediate removal is required, good faith efforts shall be made to implement a remedial discipline plan that would allow the student to remain in school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(1)(b): alternatives to suspension, including policies that allow a student to remain in school under an in-school suspension program or under a program allowing the parent, with the consent of the student's teacher or teachers, to attend class with the student for a period of time specified by a designated school official.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(2): If the parent does not agree or fails to attend class with the student, the student shall be suspended in accordance with the conduct and discipline policies of the district or the school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(3): The parent of a suspended student and the designated school official may enlist the cooperation of the Division of Child and Family Services, the juvenile court, or other appropriate state agencies, if necessary, in dealing with the student's suspension.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4): (4)(a); (4)(a) The state superintendent, in cooperation with school districts and charter schools, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(a): research methods of motivating and providing incentives to students that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(a)(i): directly and regularly reward or recognize appropriate behavior;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(a)(ii): impose immediate and direct consequences on students who fail to comply with district or school standards of conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(a)(iii): keep the students in school, or otherwise continue student learning with appropriate supervision or accountability;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(b): (4)(a) explore funding resources to implement methods of motivating and providing incentives to students that meet the criteria specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(c): (4)(a) evaluate the benefits and costs of methods of motivating and providing incentives to students that meet the criteria specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(d): publish a report that incorporates the research findings, provides model plans with suggested resource pools, and makes recommendations for local school boards and school personnel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-207(4)(e): maintain data for purposes of accountability, later reporting, and future analysis.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208 Student suspended or expelled -- Responsibility of parent -- Application for students with disabilities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(1): If a student is suspended or expelled from a public school under this part for more than 10 school days, the parent is responsible for undertaking an alternative education plan which will ensure that the student's education continues during the period of suspension or expulsion.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(2)(a): The parent shall work with designated school officials to determine how that responsibility might best be met through private education, an alternative program offered by or through the district or charter school, or other alternative which will reasonably meet the educational needs of the student.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(2)(b): The parent and designated school official may enlist the cooperation of the Division of Child and Family Services, the juvenile court, or other appropriate state agencies to meet the student's educational needs.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(3): Costs for educational services which are not provided by the school district or charter school are the responsibility of the student's parent.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(4)(a): Each school district or charter school shall maintain a record of all suspended or expelled students and a notation of the recorded suspension or expulsion shall be attached to the individual student's cumulative folder.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(4)(b): The district or charter school shall contact the parent of each suspended or expelled student under the age of 16 at least once each month to determine the student's progress.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(5)(a): This part applies to students with disabilities to the extent permissible under applicable law or regulation.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-208(5)(b): If application of any requirement of this part to a student with a disability is not permissible under applicable law or regulation, the responsible school authority shall implement other actions consistent with the conflicting law or regulation which shall most closely correspond to the requirements of this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209 Extracurricular activities -- Prohibited conduct -- Reporting of violations -- Limitation of liability.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1): The Legislature recognizes that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1)(a): participation in student government and extracurricular activities may confer important educational and lifetime benefits upon students, and encourages school districts and charter schools to provide a variety of opportunities for all students to participate in such activities in meaningful ways;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1)(b): there is no constitutional right to participate in these types of activities, and does not through this section or any other provision of law create such a right;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1)(c): students who participate in student government and extracurricular activities, particularly competitive athletics, and the adult coaches, advisors, and assistants who direct those activities, become role models for others in the school and community;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1)(d): these individuals often play major roles in establishing standards of acceptable behavior in the school and community, and establishing and maintaining the reputation of the school and the level of community confidence and support afforded the school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(1)(e): it is of the utmost importance that those involved in student government, whether as officers or advisors, and those involved in competitive athletics and related activities, whether students or staff, comply with all applicable laws and standards of behavior and conduct themselves at all times in a manner befitting their positions and responsibilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2): (2)(a); 53G-8-211; 53G-8-203(1)(e)(i); (iv); 76-10-101
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(a): The state board may, and local school boards and charter school governing boards shall, adopt rules or policies implementing this section that apply to both students and staff.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b): (2)(a); 53G-8-211; 53G-8-203(1)(e)(i); (iv); 76-10-101 The rules or policies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(i): the use of foul, abusive, or profane language while engaged in school related activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(ii): 76-10-101 the illicit use, possession, or distribution of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(ii)(A): a controlled substance or drug paraphernalia;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(ii)(B): 76-10-101 a tobacco product, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(ii)(C): an alcoholic beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(2)(b)(iii): hazing, demeaning, or assaultive behavior, whether consensual or not, including behavior involving physical violence, restraint, improper touching, or inappropriate exposure of body parts not normally exposed in public settings, forced ingestion of any substance, or any act which would constitute a crime against a person or public order under state law.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(3): (3)(a); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(3)(a): School employees who reasonably believe that a violation of this section may have occurred shall immediately report that belief to the school principal, district superintendent, or chief administrative officer of a charter school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(3)(b): (3)(a) Principals who receive a report under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(3)(c): (3) Failure of a person holding a professional certificate to report as required under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-209(4): 53G-8-405 Limitations of liability set forth under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210 Disruptive student behavior.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1): 53G-8-205; 53G-8-209(2)(b); (1)(b)(i); (ii); 53G-6-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(a): 53G-8-205; 53G-8-209(2)(b) "Disruptive student behavior" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(a)(i): 53G-8-205 the grounds for suspension or expulsion described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(a)(ii): 53G-8-209(2)(b) the conduct described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(b): (1)(b)(i); (ii) "Parent" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(b)(i): a custodial parent of a school-age child;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(b)(ii): a legally appointed guardian of a school-age child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(b)(iii): (1)(b)(i); (ii) any other person purporting to exercise any authority over the child which could be exercised by a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(c): "Qualifying minor" means a school-age child who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(c)(i): is at least nine years old; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(c)(ii): turns nine years old at any time during the school year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(d): "School year" means the period of time designated by a local school board or charter school governing board as the school year for the school where the school-age child is enrolled.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(1)(e): 53G-6-201 "School-age child" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(2): 53G-8-211 A local school board, school district, charter school governing board, or charter school may impose administrative penalties in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3)(a): A local school board or charter school governing board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3)(a)(i): authorize a school administrator or a designee of a school administrator to issue notices of disruptive student behavior to qualifying minors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3)(a)(ii): establish a procedure for a qualifying minor, or a qualifying minor's parent, to contest a notice of disruptive student behavior.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3)(b): A school representative shall provide to a parent of a school-age child, a list of resources available to assist the parent in resolving the school-age minor's disruptive student behavior problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(3)(c): A local school board or charter school governing board shall establish procedures for a school counselor or other designated school representative to work with a qualifying minor who engages in disruptive student behavior in order to attempt to resolve the minor's disruptive student behavior problems.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4): (3)(a) The notice of disruptive student behavior described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(a): shall be issued to a qualifying minor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(a)(i): engages in disruptive student behavior, that does not result in suspension or expulsion, three times during the school year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(a)(ii): engages in disruptive student behavior, that results in suspension or expulsion, once during the school year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(b): shall require that the qualifying minor and a parent of the qualifying minor:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(b)(i): meet with school authorities to discuss the qualifying minor's disruptive student behavior; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(b)(ii): cooperate with the local school board or charter school governing board in correcting the qualifying minor's disruptive student behavior; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(4)(c): shall be mailed by certified mail to, or served on, a parent of the qualifying minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5): A habitual disruptive student behavior notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a): may only be issued to a qualifying minor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a)(i): engages in disruptive student behavior, that does not result in suspension or expulsion, at least six times during the school year;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a)(ii)(A): engages in disruptive student behavior, that does not result in suspension or expulsion, at least three times during the school year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a)(ii)(B): engages in disruptive student behavior, that results in suspension or expulsion, at least once during the school year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(a)(iii): engages in disruptive student behavior, that results in suspension or expulsion, at least twice during the school year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-210(5)(b): may only be issued by a school administrator, a designee of a school administrator, or a truancy specialist, who is authorized by a local school board or charter school governing board to issue a habitual disruptive student behavior notice.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211 Responses to school-based behavior.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1): 53G-6-202; 53G-6-206; 80-1-102; 26B-5-101; 80-1-102; 53-13-103; 53G-6-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(a): "Evidence-based" means a program or practice that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(a)(i): has had multiple randomized control studies or a meta-analysis demonstrating that the program or practice is effective for a specific population;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(a)(ii): has been rated as effective by a standardized program evaluation tool; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(a)(iii): is created and developed by a school or school district and has been approved by the state board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b): 53G-6-202; 53G-6-206 "Habitual truant" means a school-age child who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b)(i): is in grade 7 or above, unless the school-age child is under 12 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b)(ii): 53G-6-202 is subject to the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b)(iii): 53G-6-206
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b)(iii)(A): is truant at least 20 days during one school year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(b)(iii)(B): 53G-6-206 fails to cooperate with efforts on the part of school authorities to resolve the school-age child's attendance problem as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(c): 80-1-102; 26B-5-101 "Minor" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(c)(i): 26B-5-101 "Mobile crisis outreach team" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(d): 80-1-102 "Prosecuting attorney" means the same as that term is defined in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(e): "Restorative justice program" means a school-based program or a program used or adopted by a local education agency that is designed:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(e)(i): to enhance school safety, reduce school suspensions, and limit referrals to law enforcement agencies and courts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(e)(ii): to help minors take responsibility for and repair harmful behavior that occurs in school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(f): "School administrator" means a principal of a school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(g): "School is in session" means a day during which the school conducts instruction for which student attendance is counted toward calculating average daily membership.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(h): 53-13-103 "School resource officer" means a law enforcement officer, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(i): 53G-6-201 "School-age child" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j)(i): "School-sponsored activity" means an activity, fundraising event, club, camp, clinic, or other event or activity that is authorized by a specific local education agency or public school, according to LEA governing board policy, and satisfies at least one of the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j)(i)(A): the activity is managed or supervised by a local education agency or public school, or local education agency or public school employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j)(i)(B): the activity uses the local education agency's or public school's facilities, equipment, or other school resources; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j)(i)(C): the activity is supported or subsidized, more than inconsequentially, by public funds, including the public school's activity funds or Minimum School Program dollars.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(j)(ii): "School-sponsored activity" includes preparation for and involvement in a public performance, contest, athletic competition, demonstration, display, or club activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(k)(i): "Status offense" means an offense that would not be an offense but for the age of the offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(1)(k)(ii): "Status offense" does not mean an offense that by statute is a misdemeanor or felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(2): This section applies to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(2)(a): a minor who is alleged to be a habitual truant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(2)(b): a minor enrolled in school who is alleged to have committed an offense on school property where the student is enrolled:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(2)(b)(i): when school is in session; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(2)(b)(ii): during a school-sponsored activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3): 80-5-102; 80-6-901; 76-10-105; 80-5-201 If a minor is alleged to have committed an offense on school property that is a class C misdemeanor, an infraction, or a status offense, or a minor is alleged to be a habitual truant, the school administrator, the school administrator's designee, or a school resource officer shall refer the minor:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a): 80-5-102; 80-6-901; 76-10-105 to an evidence-based alternative intervention, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(i): a mobile crisis outreach team;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(ii): 80-5-102 a youth services center, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(iii): 80-6-901 a certified youth court, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(iv): an evidence-based alternative intervention created and developed by the school or school district;

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(vi): 76-10-105 a tobacco cessation or education program if the offense is a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(a)(vii): truancy mediation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(3)(b): 80-5-201 for prevention and early intervention youth services, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(4): Except as provided in Subsection (6), if a minor is alleged to have committed an offense on school property that is a class C misdemeanor, an infraction, or a status offense, a school administrator, the school administrator's designee, or a school resource officer may refer a minor to a law enforcement officer or agency or a court only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(4)(a): the minor allegedly committed an offense on school property on a previous occasion; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(4)(b): the minor was referred to an evidence-based alternative intervention, or to prevention or early intervention youth services, as described in Subsection (3) for the previous offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(5): If a minor is alleged to be a habitual truant, a school administrator, the school administrator's designee, or a school resource officer may only refer the minor to a law enforcement officer or agency or a court if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(5)(a): the minor was previously alleged of being a habitual truant at least twice during the same school year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(5)(b): the minor was referred to an evidence-based alternative intervention, or for prevention and early intervention youth services, as described in Subsection (3) for at least two of the previous habitual truancies.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(6): If a minor is alleged to have committed a traffic offense that is an infraction, a school administrator, the school administrator's designee, or a school resource officer may refer the minor to a law enforcement officer or agency, a prosecuting attorney, or a court for the traffic offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(7): 80-6-201 Notwithstanding Subsections (4) and (5), a school resource officer may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(7)(a): investigate possible criminal offenses and conduct, including conducting probable cause searches;

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-211(7)(e): protect the safety of students and the school community, including the use of reasonable and necessary physical force when appropriate based on the totality of the circumstances.

Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212 Defacing or damaging school property -- Student's liability -- Work program alternative.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(1): A student who willfully defaces or otherwise damages any school property may be suspended or otherwise disciplined.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(2): 80-6-610
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(2)(a): If a school's property has been lost or willfully cut, defaced, or otherwise damaged, the school may withhold the issuance of an official written grade report, diploma, or transcript of the student responsible for the damage or loss until the student or the student's parent has paid for the damages.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(2)(b): 80-6-610 The student's parent is liable for damages as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(3)(a): If the student and the student's parent are unable to pay for the damages or if it is determined by the school in consultation with the student's parent that the student's interests would not be served if the parent were to pay for the damages, the school shall provide for a program of work the student may complete in lieu of the payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(3)(b): The school shall release the official grades, diploma, and transcripts of the student upon completion of the work.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(4): Before any penalties are assessed under this section, the school shall adopt procedures to ensure that the student's right to due process is protected.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(5): No penalty may be assessed for damages which may be reasonably attributed to normal wear and tear.
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-212(6): If the Department of Human Services or a licensed child-placing agency has been granted custody of the student, the student's records, if requested by the department or agency, may not be withheld from the department or agency for nonpayment of damages under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-213 Reintegration plan for student alleged to have committed violent felony or weapon offense.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-213(1): 53G-8-701.6; 53G-8-701.8 As used in this section,"multidisciplinary team" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-213(1)(a): the local education agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 53G-8-213(1)(b): the juvenile court;
